review.Review: North Square is a treasure.  The food is excellent.  The service is cordial and attentive.  And the room is delightful -- not fancy, but handsome and the tables are not on top of one another.  Best of all, it's one of the few places I know of where one can still have a quiet conversation with one's companions. Highly recommend.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The reasons for this classification are:

* The review starts by calling North Square a "treasure", which is a very positive and enthusiastic statement.
* The reviewer uses the word "excellent" to describe the food, which suggests a high level of quality.
* The service is described as "cordial and attentive", which indicates that the staff are friendly and responsive to the customer's needs.
* The room is described as "delightful" and the tables are "not on top of one another", which suggests a pleasant and comfortable atmosphere.
* The reviewer mentions that it's one of the few places where you can have a "quiet conversation with one's companions", which suggests that the atmosphere is conducive to a pleasant dining experience.
* The reviewer highly recommends the restaurant and gives it a 4-star rating, which further reinforces the positive sentiment.

Overall, the review is overwhelmingly positive, with no negative comments or criticisms mentioned.

Good service, warm welcome, a charming Greenwich Village restaurant.

review.Review: Four of us started with happy hour followed by dinner. Very pleasant service. Food was solid. We got calamari, quesadilla, sirloin steak, duck, and a halibut special. While not ultra gourmet, a solid place for a good meal. And happily, it wasn’t too noisy. You won’t be disappointed.

review.Review: The lounge area for dining is quite nice, cozy, and an attractive room. There were very few diners this particular evening in the lounge, so the sound level was quiet. The main dining room is also quite nice, but on this particular evening the door was open and the warm air wafting in made the temperature too warm for my comfort. Both rooms are lovely.

review.Review: It is one of the great mysteries of NYC why this restaurant isn't more popular.  But then again, maybe I should be careful what I wish for.  I have been to North Square 5 times in the past year, and it delivered very, very good food, especially for the price, at each visit.  There are always an array of daily specials, every one proving to have been a wise choice.  The wine list is solid and appropriately priced.  The restaurant is comfortable, congenial, and attractively designed.  The sound level allows conversation with your table mates to be pleasant, without needing to cup your ear to hear each other.  The food is delicious,  expertly prepared, and confidently served by the congenial waitstaff.  If you haven't tried it, you owe it to yourself to give it a try.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify the sentiment of this review as 'positive'.

The reviewer uses phrases such as "one of the great mysteries of NYC why this restaurant isn't more popular", implying that they highly recommend the restaurant and are puzzled by its relatively low popularity. They also use superlatives like "very, very good food", "great", "solid", "attractive", and "delicious" to describe the food, wine list, and ambiance. Additionally, they mention that the service is "confidently served" and the waitstaff is "congenial". The only potential hint of caution is the phrase "but then again, maybe I should be careful what I wish for", which suggests that the reviewer is worried that if the restaurant becomes more popular, it might lose its charm. However, this is a minor concern and does not affect the overall positive tone of the review.

Thank you!

review.Review: North Square has been a favorite neighborhood spot for several years.  The food is consistently good, it is reasonably priced and we could always count on it for an enjoyable dinner out.  However, the last few times we have been here, there has been a noticeable issue with service.  At our last visit, we were seated for 20 minutes before anyone came over and asked about drinks or food order (and this was only after my husband went up to the bar to inquire).  Two women sitting by us had a similar experience, albeit an even longer time without service.  This has happened a few times now and at first we attributed it to newer staff post COVID but enough time has passed for adequate training.  The food remains reliable so we will give it a few more chances but I  do hope that management can improve the service with either new or additional staffing.  It's a solid neighborhood place so it would be a shame if we had to stop dining here.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'negative' with a neutral inclination. Here's why:

The review starts off positively, mentioning that North Square has been a favorite neighborhood spot for several years and that the food is consistently good and reasonably priced. This suggests a positive impression of the restaurant.

However, the review takes a turn when the writer describes the disappointing service they experienced at their last few visits. They mention specific problems, such as long waits for service and staff not coming over to take orders, and attribute it to a lack of adequate training. This is a significant criticism of the restaurant's service.

Although the writer expresses hope that the service will improve and says they are willing to give the restaurant a few more chances, the negative comments about service outweigh the positive ones. The reviewer's choice to give the restaurant a 4-star rating instead of a lower rating suggests that the good aspects of their experience (food quality and price) were not enough to overcome the poor service.

Overall, while the review is not uniformly negative, the negative comments about service dominate the sentiment, making it a negative review overall.

review.Review: I really love the unique twists given to dishes by North Square Chef Yoel Cruz. I love his lamb burger with homemade pickles, his calamari with its special tangy sauce, his eggs McDougal with spinach and smoked salmon, his caesar kale salad with mini croustades serving as croutons...I could go on. Suffice to say Chef Yoel's special touch makes North Square a must for dining in the Big Apple.

I would definitely come back here again !

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Their covid safety measures are great. Hand sanitizer at the door, individual heated tents outside for single parties for outdoor dining and extremely nice polite servers who are attentive. I took points away for the food. It’s meh. Not sure if it’s the exact items we orders that are so blah or what. 🤷🏼

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'mixed' (not entirely positive or negative), but with a slightly negative leaning. Here's why:

The reviewer starting by praising the restaurant's COVID safety measures, using words like "great", "nice", and "polite" to describe the servers. This suggests that the reviewer was impressed with the restaurant's effort to prioritize customer safety.

However, the reviewer then deducts points for the food, which they describe as "meh", "bland", and "nothing to write home about". They specifically mention that the mushroom truffle soup, lamb burger, and brunch platter were all unimpressive, with the reviewer even questioning whether it was the specific items they ordered that were the problem or if it was a general issue. This criticism of the food cancels out much of the positive sentiment expressed earlier in the review.

Overall, while the reviewer did appreciate the restaurant's safety measures, their disappointment with the food outweighs the positive comments, making the review leaning slightly towards being negative.

We felt perfectly sAfe and warm sitting outside in our own little cabana with heater. The Thanksgiving selections were festive and appropriately autumnal. I chose a harvest salad appetizer with roasted delicata squash and a venison entree with creamy polenta and root vegetables. Both of our desserts were good to the last bite and had beautiful flaky crusts. Will return for sure!

review.Review: North Square is a very nice, relatively small restaurant. It is very peaceful and pleasant. review.Review: On a below freezing day, I delicately navigated the mounded frozen snow at the curb, dragging my luggage behind me, descended a few stairs and stepped into the warm hospitality of North Square. Within seconds I was greeted, my luggage and coat whisked away and I was seated at a sunny table near a brilliantly lit window. Menus appeared as soon as our drink order was taken and the day only got better with scrumptious, flavor packed shrimp risotto, and other tasty warm morsels. I can hardly wait to go back. The hostess was gracious, the server attentive and kind and the restaurant was a cozy sanctuary from the bitter cold.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review:
Gem in a Hotel Basement
A friend recommended North Square as a good place to eat where one could actually converse without strain (rare in the Village). It was as advertised: elegant,  quiet and I was warmly greeted and seated. The waiter seemed a little unfocused but when my friends and I ordered drinks and appetizers,  we knew what we wanted for entrees and went ahead with our order. 
The oysters and polenta sticks arrived looking delicious and we were about to indulge when our entrees were set down as well. We were at a smaller table in the bar so it was a tight fit. We could have sent them back but I hate to waste food and I try to be polite. So we managed. However, I did speak to the Maitre 'D on the way out. 
Other than that, everything was lovely and I would return. But not to that waiter.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'. Here's my reasoning:

* The reviewer uses positive adjectives to describe the restaurant, such as "elegant", "quiet", and "warmly greeted".
* They mention that the restaurant lives up to its recommendation, which suggests that they were pleased with their experience.
* They specifically state that "everything was lovely" and that they would return, except for the waiter.
* The reviewer does mention some issues with the service, specifically with the waiter being "a little unfocused" and the tight fit at the table. However, they also mention that they managed to make do and didn't let it ruin their overall experience.

review.Review:
North Square is one of very few Manhattan restaurants that I return to.  I've never had anything but good experiences there, and ditto my guests.  First of all the service starting at the entrance door and continuing through to dessert and coffee are always are friendly, top notch.  The wait staff, likewise, is friendly, helpful, and really offer a big assist helping the customers pick out their main course - i.e., something that you will like and something you believe will amount to a delicious dinner at a value price.
The food itself is very good, whether meat, fish, pasta.  The dinner plate sizes are just right and are roomy enough to provide for a tasty, very good meal at a decent price.     
There's no rushing the customer at North Square.  Waiters and other staff are clearly on the lookout to remove plates when customers finish each course, but they're not hovering over each customer to see them finish a course.
Besides offering a variety of meals at decent prices,  the restaurant is busy but yet quiet enough to have pleasant across-the-table conversation.  For me, the restaurant offers the right mix of food and ambiance - and that's what most of us are looking for when having a pleasant dinner with friends or colleagues
Give this place a try and you may well become a repeat customer too, like me.

positive_comments.analysis: I classify this review as 'positive'. My reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses superlatives to describe their experience, such as "one of very few", "always friendly", "top notch", "very good", and "delicious". They also mention specific aspects of the restaurant that they enjoyed, including the service, food, and ambiance. Additionally, they mention that they have never had a bad experience at the restaurant and have returned multiple times, which suggests a high level of satisfaction. The reviewer's conclusion, "Give this place a try and you may well become a repeat customer too, like me", further reinforces their positive sentiment. review.Review: After two bad experiences, I wrote a review here and asked North Square to contact me for details. And they did! Priscilla called me and was fantastic. The only reason I’m not assigning a top score is because it took three tries to get the kale salad the way I’d ordered it - no cheese and no onions :) But the waiter apologized over and over and over, so it didn’t affect our overall experience, which was terrific. Can’t wait to go back, very soon! Thanks, North Square!

review.Review:
First, the decor can be a little off-putting, because nothing about it says "heart of the West Village" or conveys the history of Washington Square Park, where it's located.  In fact, you could be in "Anywhere, USA".  But don't let the decor put you off. 

I've eaten there a few times and the food is always excellent.  2 of us had arctic char, which was prepared perfectly: moist, with a crunch skin.  One person at the table orders duck wherever she goes, and she couldn't say enough about how delicious it was there.  The birthday boy had rack of lamb, which he had eaten there many times before, and he loved it.  Someone else had salmon, and she likes it almost completely raw.  She complains constantly at restaurants that it isn't rare enough, but they got it right.  The servers are attentive to requests and they don't get it wrong.

Perhaps most importantly, the noise level is low and everyone can hear everyone else.  I'm tired of straining my voice in restaurants.  I suppose the noise level at so many NYC restaurants  is supposed to give it a festive mood, but I strain my voice enough in my work; I don't like to fight ambient noise when I'm eating.  I'm young, but 2 members of our party were older, and noisy restaurants just don't work for them.  The volume at this place is perfect.

Obviously, it's not a secret in the neighborhood.  The place appears to have a lot of loyal locals, many of whom look liked they've lived in the area for a long time.  I suppose there are some people from the hotel that houses the restaurant.  But, mostly, it seemed to be people like us who wanted to eat a delicious dinner, celebrate a birthday (there was another birthday at a table nearby) and enjoy the company of their friends/family without all the noise.

We are becoming regulars.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as positive.

Reason: Although the reviewer mentions some negative aspects of the restaurant, such as the decor being "off-putting" and lacking the character of the surrounding West Village, these comments are minor and don't overshadow the reviewer's overall positive experience. They highlight the excellent food, attentive service, low noise level, and welcoming atmosphere, which are all praised. Additionally, the reviewer mentions becoming regulars at the restaurant, which implies a strong positive attachment to the establishment.

Bottom Line up-front: We like North Square a lot and have come here for years. Years.

However, this particular occasion, it felt different. Maybe it was the loud-talkers (very unusual for this place) across the center aisle. Or the boisterous babies (also unusual). But also, the casual formality seemed to be missing, which was a little sad. But, we'll be back. Oh yes, we'll be back.

The review starts by stating that the reviewer "like[s] North Square a lot" and have been going there for years, indicating a strong positive sentiment. However, they also mention that the occasion felt "different" due to a few specific factors, such as loud talkers and boisterous babies, which detracted from the usual experience and made them feel like something was missing. review.Review: This restaurant was quite a delight! We were staying at the Washington Square Hotel and needed someplace close for dinner, but were worried because sometimes hotels don't have the best eateries . We noticed right away that everyone who came in was a local and appeared to eat there regularly, and we saw why. The crab and corn salad was perfectly seasoned and very fresh. The rack of lamb with its dusting of parsley/mint/herbs, which were finely grated, was a divine flavor combination. Since I always order my meat medium rare, I was super happy to find a chef who REALLY knows how to do that properly (perfectly pink inside, crusty on the outside and hot all the way through!) The AuGratin potato accompaniment was also beautifully prepared with delicate, yet amazing flavor. Lastly, the creme brûlée was prepared with roasted coconut- unexpected and delicious!! We will definitely eat here again!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as **POSITIVE**.

review.Review: North Square restaurant is one of the few gems left from the old W. review.Review: We were in town to see a show at NYU and needed a place close by.  I chose North Square strictly because of it's proximity.  My husband and I and another couple were immediately impressed with the ambience.  The waitress was very personable and at our request recommended her favorites on the menu - which we went with and loved!  The portions were large, delicious and very filling.  We did not think we would have room for dessert but went ahead and ordered 3 different items to share.  When our original waitress returned she asked us what we had ordered and was disappointed that we hadn't ordered the key lime pie.  So we did and that turned out to be the best choice.   We will definitely be back!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses overwhelmingly positive language to describe their experience at North Square. They mention being "impressed" with the ambience, that the waitress was "very personable" and recommended dishes that they "loved". They also highlight the size and deliciousness of the portions, stating that they were "large", "delicious", and "very filling". Additionally, they report being so satisfied that they ordered multiple desserts to share, and even changed their mind to try the key lime pie at the recommendation of the waitress. review.Review:
My husband and I were blown away by both the quality of food and the level of service. It was our first time dining here, so our attentive waitress provided a few recommendations. 

First, if they have crab cakes on the menu, get the crab cakes!

We ordered a nice bottle of Pinot so it would couldn't both salmon and lamb. Both entrees were tasty, perfectly, prepared, and plated nicely. In fact, the lamb was so good that I almost forgot my table manners :)

We rarely (never) get dessert, and our waitress surprised us with their signature key lime pie. It was amazing!

In short, make your reservation today. We can't wait to go back.

review.Review: North Square is part of what once the most horrific hotel in NYC. I had to stay there in my youth for reasons that no longer matter.  Many years ago, someone snatched it up, cleared it out and made it a little NYC gem, a stellar boutique hotel that includes this delightful dining spot, North Square.  It's a place where normal people eat. And that doesn't mean "old" or "out of touch."  Just people who love good food, don't read their e-mails while dining, respond to the warmth and knowledge of its waitstaff, the lovely wine list,  un-shocking prices--and just damned good food, superbly prepared and served on time.  I have brought several people from out of town here who request that we return when they visit again. And you don't have to call 30 days in advance for a reservation. A true little treasure just across from Washington Square Park which, despite greedy developers, remains intact and beautiful. If you're after a completely lovely evening, here it is.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Went there with friends and we all really enjoyed our meals. Especially liked the chopped salad and the fish entrees. I was extremely pleased when our waiter topped off my second glass of wine as a courtesy when he saw that it was gone and I had not finished my meal. He gave me a little extra--I thought that was terrific. It's little things like that that would incline me to come back to the restaurant. It's NYC and the truth is, there are a lot of upscale great restaurants. Great, welcoming service is harder to find, in my opinion. Oh and I forgot--when ordering wine by the glass we were given a chance to taste it first and say yes or no. I've never seen that before. Food and service and ambiance were all outstanding.

review.Review: My wife and I dined at North Square, for the very first time, in celebration of her birthday. We topped off dinner with dessert; I had the key lime pie and it too was splendid.  We also had two excellent sauterne dessert wines, and very much enjoyed such a sweet end to our fantastic evening at North Square.  We highly recommend this neighborhood gem.

review.Review: A friend and I went to North Square for dinner on a Monday night  at about 8:00 PM.  We were seated promptly and were given our menus and water.  Although it was restaurant week, we decided  to order from the regular menu.  For an appetizer, I had the scallops risotto, which was one of the specials for the night and my friend had a crab meat salad.  Both were delicious.  For the main course, I had the breast of duck, which was prepared medium, just as I requested.  My friend had the fish special which was moist and not overcooked as  has happened on occasion in other restaurants.  We were very pleased with the main courses.  For desert, we ordered the platter of cookies which was a nice assortment of chocolate and other flavors.  It was more than enough for two but so good we finished all of them.  We also ordered a bottle of the French Bordeaux (2010 vintage) that was offered as a special for restaurant week  even though one of us was having fish.  We both enjoyed it so much that we hope to be able to find a place where we can buy it for home use.  All in all a fantastic evening.   We look forward to returning to North Square soon!

positive_comments.analysis:
**Positive**

Reason: The review is overwhelmingly positive, with the reviewer using phrases such as "delicious", "very pleased", "fantastic evening", and "hope to be able to find a place where we can buy it for home use" to describe their experience. The reviewer also gives the restaurant a perfect 5-star rating, indicating a high level of satisfaction. review.Review:
Nicely done for first week of restaurant week.  Unlike some other restuarants this one puts THREE separate menus in place, one for each week.  We went for the first of the three, which was the least quirky menu, with mostly winter comfort foods on the list.  Nicely limited menu, with just the right kind of variety.  The appetizer of gnocchi with a variety of flavorings was really a sort of Asian-Mexican-American Fusion dish.  The New England Clam Chowder was a leek and potato based soup, rather than an overly cream-based-artery clogger.  The broth contain a number of large plump clams, which inspires the kid in your brain with treasure hunt anticipation.  Pork rib-eye was perfectly done comfort food, with one outstanding quality.  This was the most tender perfectly cooked pork chop I've ever eaten, and I've had a few.  Another stand out, the coffee Crème Brule was the most generous such desert size I've yet seen.  This is especially nice for sharing.  The pricing for restaurant week wasn't an outrageous bargain; essentially you get the desert for free.  But on the plus side, at $3.00 a cup, this restaurant also doesn't rip you off for $5.00 for a cup of tea or coffee, as many do. 

The crowd was an odd mix of aging dowagers, just barely doddering into their seats, left-over Village hippie era retirees, who likely live in the area and won't give up their Brownstones until they are dead, maybe even not then (their kids will inherit them), and a few youngish loved-up couples on a romantic date.  

Service was attentive and pleasant, just right, despite the place being busy on a Thursday night.  The flow was impressive.  Tables would empty and fill right up again, so the reservation scheduling was clearly seamless and well done - and required if you want to get a table on a busy evening.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'. Here's my reasoning:

* The reviewer uses positive adjectives such as "nicely done", "nicely limited", "perfectly cooked", "most tender", and "generous" to describe their experience.
* They specifically highlight the unique features of the restaurant, such as the three separate menus for Restaurant Week, the variety of dishes on the menu, and the generous portion sizes.
* They also praise the service, describing it as "attentive and pleasant" and the flow of the restaurant as "impressive".
* Although they mention that the pricing during Restaurant Week was not an "outrageous bargain", they also commend the restaurant for not ripping off customers with high prices for coffee and tea.
* The only potentially negative comment is about the eclectic crowd, but the reviewer describes this as an "odd mix" rather than a problem, and doesn't seem to find it off-putting.

Overall, the reviewer's positive comments and praise for the restaurant's features, service, and value outweigh the few minor criticisms they mention.

review.Review: We tried this restaurant because it was a 1,000 point special.  Try this place if you are in the neighborhood and want solid, reasonably priced food. Also, when I ordered the duck, she stated that the chef suggested that it be served "medium" or it would be "tough."  Suggestion: buy better duck.  In the neither here nor there category, we were the youngest people in the restaurant by about 25 years.  If you are looking for the next trendy spot, keep moving.

review.Review: The food was delicious and the waitstaff quick and attentive. My mimosa glass never stayed empty! The Jazz band was fantastic too. Mostly the standards with some Christmas music thrown in (we were there on Dec. 13th).  Alexis Cole has a warm voice, perfect for jazz.

review.Review: North Square has become our go-to restaurant near Washington Square Park. Highly recommended for NYU parents and visitors. Food is inventive without being crazy, service is expert and prices are appropriate. Helps to fill the void with the departure of Blue Hill.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: I avoid brunch usually: I don't eat pancakes or waffles and I tire of endless egg dishes.  NS offers non-traditional brunch fare, more like a mix of brunch and lunch dishes.  They make a mean traditional Caesar salad - you can taste the lemon and the anchovies and the lettuce is broken into bite-size pieces, not the big leaves that require a knife to negotiate.  The Arctic char was perfectly broiled and rested on a bed of garlicy steamed spinach and a thin potato galette.  And they know how to make a perfect Hendrick's martini that meets my picky expectations.

positive_comments.analysis: I classify this review as 'positive'. The reviewer mentions several specific dishes that they enjoyed, including the Caesar salad, Arctic char, and Hendrick's martini. They use descriptive language to highlight the quality and taste of these dishes, such as "a mean traditional Caesar salad", "perfectly broiled", and "taste the lemon and the anchovies". They also indicate that the menu offers something different from traditional brunch fare, which they appreciate. The only negative sentiment expressed in the review is a general statement that the reviewer avoids brunch usually, but this is not a comment about the specific restaurant being reviewed. Overall, the tone of the review is positive and enthusiastic, with the reviewer expressing several specific things they liked about their experience at the restaurant.

Friendly ambiance and neighborly warmth make it one of our all-time favorites.

review.Review: I loved the great jazz with the Roz Corral Trio.  The Mediterranean omelette was delicious, with just the right amount of fontina cheese, accompanied by a side of lightly dressed refreshing greens and a tasty scone.  Try the Brunch Prix Fixe for a great value.  You can't beat North Square for a Sunday Jazz Brunch.

Too bad.  I used to like this place but I doubt now I('ll go back.

review.Review: Lovely, moderately priced restaurant in Greenwich Village. There were 4 people in our party and each of us enjoyed our lunch. Three of us had omelettes with a choice of fillings and a side salad instead of potatoes. The coffee was excellent.

review.Review: North Square does not disappoint.  One of the few Village restaurants with the ability to have an adult conversation (without shouting).  The food is consistently very good, while the wine list is a bit eclectic, with typically Manhattan mark-ups.  If you want a relaxing, enjoyable dinner, consider North Square.

review.Review: North Square is a great and always reliable place for a jazz brunch in the City.   Rox Corral brings an ever changing and world class jazz ensemble to this quaint Village restaurant each Sunday.  Aside from the top flight music talent, the kitchen turns out some tasty brunch cuisine.  Starting with the assorted bread basket, I'd highly recommend the brunch pre fixe, with an assortment of sweet and savory items to please any diner.  Service was excellent and very attentive.  North Square is a must visit for any serious lover of good food and jazz on a Sunday.

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment: Positive

Reason: The review praises the restaurant in several areas, including the jazz performance, food, and service. The reviewer uses positive language to describe the experience, such as "great", "always reliable", "world class", "top flight", "excellent", and "must visit". The only neutral aspect mentioned is the "quaint Village restaurant" which is not explicitly positive or negative. review.Review: We have been to North Square many times an have always had a very fine meal and experience, otherwise we wouldn't keep going back. This time, we were very disappointed, from the moment we came in (with a reservation). Noticing many tables that would be able to accommodate the two of us (not encroaching on fours), we were rudely told we had to take the seats in the fron by the door. The server was friendly, helpful and accommodating, but the dinner (Duck Breast ) lacked flavor  and was not up to their usual standard. We propably will not return and will not recommend the restaurant to friends.

review.Review:
North Square has become one of my 'go to" restaurants when I am in the neighborhood.
The food has been consistantly good, the service professional but friendly and unpretentious, and the noise level conversational.

review.Review:
Located very near Washington Square (and attached to a small hotel), North Square restaurant provides a nice place to relax in Greenwich.

Quiet and with tables suited more for small groups, the restaurant has a dimly lit but somehow vibrant bar where you can relax before or after your meal.

The selections on the three-course menu were all tasty - even the herb-roasted chicken was tender and juicy.

We visited on Halloween, and even with the distraction of costumes and the preparations for the parade, the servers are professional and attentive. 

It would be easy to recommend this restaurant to a friend.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'. Here's why:

* The reviewer mentions several positive aspects of the restaurant, including its convenient location, quiet atmosphere, and delicious food (specifically, the herb-roasted chicken).
* The reviewer also compliments the servers, stating that they are "professional and attentive" even on a busy day (Halloween).
* The reviewer explicitly concludes that they would "easy to recommend this restaurant to a friend", which is a strong indication of a positive sentiment.
* The only potential drawback mentioned is the dimly lit bar, but the reviewer describes it as "vibrant", which could be an unintended positive comment.

Overall, the reviewer's comments focus on the restaurant's pleasant atmosphere, good food, and excellent service, which suggests a positive sentiment. The 3-star rating also supports this classification, as it is a moderate level of praise but not a completely negative assessment.

review.Review: Solid food, nice clean decor, and you are not seated on top of the other diners so you can actually have a nice conversation.

review.Review:
I was pleasantly surprised, I did not know that such a cozy hide-away for a tasty brunch existed in the neighborhood. The live jazz performance is certainly a plus!
I guess most locals know about it as there was literally a traffic jam in the entrance, even at 2PM. My only reservation is that there is really nowhere to wait if there is a big line to get a table, even if you have reservations. I opted to exit to the street and come in through the hotel lobby, where there are comfortable sofas.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive' with some reservations. review.Review: Very lovely, and quiet brunch (despite HUGE protest going on outside - wouldn't have even noticed it, because it was so lovely and calm on the inside.)  Waitstaff was attentive, friendly and generous.  Food was scrumptious and they had a pretty unique menu for brunch, which is rare to find in NYC.

review.Review: North Square is an excellent, low key restaurant which offers very good value.  It's quiet and private.  The food is reliably good.  The wine list is very good.  The service is generally fine.  It can on occasion be somewhat on the slow side.  Not a place to go to if you are going to be in a rush.  It's quiet which is good for conversation.

An overall enjoyable experience.

review.Review: Thought we would try to stay in on a very rainy and windy night. We're glad we did, great food, atmosphere and service. Will eat here often when in the city.

review.Review: This was my second visit to North Square, the last time for dinner.  I thoroughly enjoyed my crab and pear salad entree.  Best of all the setting is quiet and the tables are well spaced so I could spend quality time with my dining companion is easy to hear conversation.  Service was more than impeccable.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review: Excellent brunch, EXCELLENT. Great portion sizes mean you don't go away hungry, nice jazz to enjoy your food with, customer service is perfectly paced - the food arrives in great time if you need to get somewhere. We thoroughly enjoyed the jazz brunch experience and would highly recommend it to anyone - especially for any first timers in New York who really want to get that New York feel. Thank you North Square!

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: My husband and I decided to stay over the the city and go out for a jazz brunch on Sunday morning.  North Square's brunch had received very good reviews.  Boy were we disappointed.  The food and service were good.  We think the music was good but the  people at other tables were talking so loud you couldn't hear the music.  It was very distracting and rude to the singer.    If they wanted to talk why didn't they sit in the restaurant room as opposed to the lounge.  North Square did nothing to encourage the table to listen to the music.The lounge only has 10 tables which should make for an excellent and intimate jazz brunch.  This was not bettter then background musc being pumped in.  We would never go back or suggest friends go.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'negative'.

* They mention that the food is "very good quality for the price", which suggests that they were satisfied with the value they received.
* They specifically highlight the deliciousness of the vegetable plate and the fish, which further reinforces their positive opinion.
* The reviewer also mentions that the restaurant is "nice for families", which implies that it is a welcoming and suitable option for a family outing.
* Finally, the reviewer, who is French living in NYC, explicitly recommends the restaurant, which suggests that they hold it in high regard.

Overall, the review is filled with positive language and lacks any negative comments, which leads me to classify it as 'positive'.

review.Review: Great jazz brunch: talented musicians; casual and fun but tranquil ambiance;  terrific service; decent drinks and food at reasonable prices.  This small room is a Village local favorite.

review.Review: There was something for everyone, it was quiet enough for the 6 of us to have a conversation without shouting across the table. The ambiance wasn't anything special but was pleasant and relaxing. I found out about the jazz brunch so I'm definitely coming back for some music and bacon! :)

After analyzing the review, I classify it as **positive**.

The reasons for this classification are:

2. The ambiance is described as "pleasant and relaxing", which is a positive aspect.

The only potentially negative comment is that the ambiance wasn't "anything special", but this is a relatively minor criticism, and the overall tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: Came here to for a casual dinner and for a friends birthday with a small group, the ambiance is just nice and peaceful, We mainly ordered seafood dishes, food was delishh. Overall, its not exactly oustanding, but still a good dinner when you have good company.

positive_comments.analysis:

* The food being "delishh"

The reviewer also mentions that having good company makes the dinner even better, which implies that the social aspect of the dinner was a big part of their positive experience.

Overall, while the reviewer doesn't have high praise for the restaurant, they do appear to have enjoyed their dinner and would likely recommend it to others, which is why I classify the review as 'positive' with a neutral undertone.

review.Review: Food here is always lovely, very simple but well prepared. One of the few places to serve excellent bread with olive oil without people asking. Tuna tartare is very good, as are salads

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The review starts by stating that the "food here is always lovely", which is a strong positive statement. It then goes on to describe the food as "simple but well prepared", which suggests that the reviewer appreciates the quality of the cooking. The reviewer also specifically mentions a few dishes that they enjoy, including the "tuna tartare" and "salads", which reinforces their positivity. The only slightly negative comment is the inclusion of "One of the few places to serve excellent bread with olive oil without people asking", which implies that the reviewer believes that this is something that not all restaurants do well. However, this is not enough to outweigh the overall positive tone of the review, and the reviewer's high rating (4 out of 5 stars) further supports this classification.

review.Review:
My wife and I just has brunch at North Square. It was really wonderful. The food was excellent, the service was really good and the price was very reasonable, about $40.00 tax and tip, but no drinks other than coffee. My wife had the Cinnamon & Apple Belgian Waffle. One of her pet peeves is when we have brunch, the food does not come to the table hot. The waffle was just off the grill and was really good. I had the Brunch Tasting (Baby Pumpkin Pecan Pancakes, Two Scrambled Eggs, Chicken & Apple Sausage, Home Fries). The pancakes were excellent, the sausage was just beautiful. We both decided that if the brunch was this nice and this reasonable, we really have to try their dinner.
This was a wonderful way to start a day.

positive_comments.analysis: I classify this review as 'positive'. My reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses several positive adjectives to describe their experience, including "wonderful", "excellent", "really good", and "beautiful". They also mention specific dishes that they enjoyed, such as the Cinnamon & Apple Belgian Waffle and the Baby Pumpkin Pecan Pancakes, and state that the price was "very reasonable". The reviewer also expresses enthusiasm about trying the restaurant's dinner options in the future, which suggests that they were very satisfied with their experience. The overall tone of the review is positive and enthusiastic, with no negative comments about the food, service, or price.

review.Review: Classic dishes, always prepared with care and with first-class ingredients.  Ideal location for an excellent and tranquil meal.

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment Analysis:

The sentiment of this review is **positive**.

Reason: The review uses words with positive connotations such as "Classic", "first-class", "excellent", and "tranquil", indicating a high level of satisfaction with the dining experience. The reviewer also mentions that the dishes are prepared with "care" and that the location is "ideal" for a great meal, further emphasizing their positive sentiment. The 5-star rating also supports this classification, as a high rating typically indicates a very positive review.

review.Review: We've been going to North Square since we couldn't afford it. Now, we bring friends (unless we want a quiet dinner alone together). Some welcome updates to the menu, still a quiet, reserved and friendly ambiance: just what we like. So, thanks!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as "positive".

The reason for my classification is that the reviewer mentions several positive aspects of their experience at North Square. They state that they "bring friends" to the restaurant, indicating that it's a place they enjoy sharing with others. They also mention that the menu has received "welcome updates", implying that the changes are a positive development. Additionally, they describe the ambiance as "quiet, reserved and friendly", which suggests that the atmosphere is pleasant and conducive to a good dining experience. The reviewer ends the review by expressing gratitude with the phrase "So, thanks!", which further reinforces the positive sentiment.

review.Review: I have been going to North Square off and on since it opened. In the past decade or more it has become a hidden gem at the Square, with outstanding food and atmosphere (quiet) and service informal but attentive.  But on this past visit the service was poor and the food seemed skimpy. I hope it was just one of those days.

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I would classify it as 'negative'. Here's a brief reason why:

Although the reviewer mentions that North Square is a "hidden gem" and has generally been a positive experience in the past, they specifically criticize the service and food on their most recent visit, saying it was "poor" and "skimpy", respectively. The reviewer also expresses disappointment and hope that it was just a one-off, which indicates a negative sentiment. The 3-star rating also suggests a mediocre experience, which reinforces the negative classification.

review.Review: Not really sure how this place has such high reviews, other than the fact that my expectations must have been too high. Wanted a nice, new place in that neighborhood that we'd never been to. Didn't realize it was attached to a hotel, and it also seemed like a hotel restaurant when you walked in. In fact, it smelled like hotel breakfast (coffee, etc). No one other than us was under the age of 65 on a weeknight. No complaints about the service. The food was just okay. Crostini's missed the mark...none of the flavor profiles really went together and duck confit was poor quality. Tuna tartare was okay, but I didn't like the combination of all the diced raw veggies in it. The fish quality was good, though. For mains, the duck was okay, but had an over-fried spring roll and random black beans on top. My date had the lamb which was pretty good. I don't want to dog the restaurant, it wasn't bad, but it was just small and hotel-ish and the food was not outstanding. I think if I knew that going in, I would have had different expectations.  There's all these mentions of jazz nights there...no idea where they have the room to play jazz music.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'negative' with a brief reason being: The reviewer expresses disappointment and low expectations with their dining experience at the restaurant. They mention that the food was "just okay", the crostini missed the mark, and the duck confit was of poor quality. They also mention that the atmosphere was too "hotel-ish" and that the restaurant didn't meet their expectations. The reviewer does mention some positive aspects, such as good fish quality and their date's lamb dish being "pretty good", but the overall tone of the review is negative.

review.Review: Enjoyed our brunch here. The food was good and the jazz music/singer made it even better!

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive'. My reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses the phrase "enjoyed our brunch" which indicates a positive experience. They also mention that the "food was good" and that the "jazz music/singer made it even better", which suggests that the ambiance and entertainment added to their overall enjoyment. The only potential negative aspect is the 4-star rating, which could imply that the reviewer had some minor criticisms, but the overall tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: We have eaten here a few times when we have been in NYC.  Good food and a nice, attentive staff. I would definitely recommend for a nice, quiet evening.  I'll have to get to the jazz brunch one of these times.

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I classify it as 'positive'. Here's a brief reason:

* The reviewer mentions "good food", which suggests a positive experience with the taste and quality of the food.
* They also compliment the "nice, attentive staff", which indicates a pleasant and helpful service.
* The reviewer specifically recommends the restaurant for a "nice, quiet evening", implying that they enjoyed their previous experiences and would recommend it to others.
* The tone of the review is overall positive and encouraging, with no complaints or negative comments.

The 5-star rating also reinforces the positive sentiment of the review.

review.Review: Loved the jazz listening room - it's separate so those enjoying brunch who aren't into music can sit elsewhere in the restaurant and enjoy themselves equally without disturbing the music listening experience. The quality of the performers is fantastic!  I heard vocalist Roz Corral with Ron Affif on guitar and Paul Gill on bass - an intimate and engaging way to enjoy a Sunday morning. The food was enjoyable though not incredible. It was however very affordable and there was no music charge. Talk about a deal!  This is my third time attending as an out of town guest - and the experience has always been great. Part of my NY routine. Reservations are highly recommended (especially if coming to hear the music) as it's not s huge place. The wait staff was *so* responsive, courteous and inviting.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

Here's a brief reason for my classification:

The reviewer uses very positive language throughout the review, such as "Loved", "fantastic", "intimate and engaging", "great", "Part of my NY routine", and "*so* responsive, courteous and inviting". They specifically mention that the quality of the performers is great and that the food, although not incredible, was enjoyable and affordable. The reviewer has also had a great experience on multiple occasions, which suggests a high level of satisfaction. The only minor criticism is that the food was not "incredible", but this is hardly a significant drawback given the other positive aspects of the review. Overall, the reviewer's comments are very positive and enthusiastic, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their experience.

review.Review:
I enjoy this comfortable cozy restaurant . Nice place to have very  a good meal and be able to have conservation with your party. The  restaurant week menu offered  a nice variety. The chopped corn salad was excellent as was the duck. The servers were appropriately friendly and very knowledgeable of  both the food and wine menus.
I will keep this one top on my list.

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment: Positive

Reason: The review expresses a high level of satisfaction with the restaurant, using positive adjectives such as "comfortable", "cozy", "nice", "excellent", and "friendly". The reviewer mentions specific dishes they enjoyed and compliments the servers on their level of knowledge about the menu. The review also concludes by stating that the restaurant will be kept "top on my list", indicating a strong positive impression. Overall, the review is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: Living in the village we visited North Square restaurant for the first time Saturday evening and it was perfect. The staff was pleasant place was quiet enough to have a conversation   And the food was super my softshell crab was done to perfection and my partners   Summer crab salad was great our entrées of roasted chicken breast and short rib we're done to perfection and then finished with a wonderful chocolate dessert   The waitstaff shared duties and they were both so confident Matt and Jordan were very welcoming and the whole experience makes us anxious for our next visit  definitely try the prefixed menu the best deal in town

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reasons for this classification are:

* The reviewer uses superlatives such as "perfect", "great", and "wonderful" to describe their experience.
* They mention that the staff was "pleasant", the place was "quiet enough to have a conversation", and the food was "done to perfection".
* They specifically praise the waitstaff, Matt and Jordan, as being "very welcoming" and confident.

Overall, the review is extremely positive and enthusiastic, with the reviewer praising almost every aspect of their experience.

review.Review: North Square is a delightful place to have a delicious brunch while listening to world class jazz performers.  I enjoyed the always wonderful Roz Corral and her trio over the well priced Brunch Prix Fixe menu.  The omelette was cooked to perfection and accompanied by a yummy bread basket.  This place is a gem!

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive'. The reviewer uses positive adjectives to describe their experience, such as "delightful", "world class", "wonderful", "yummy", and "gem". They also mention specific aspects of their meal that they enjoyed, including the cooking of the omelette and the bread basket. Additionally, they give the highest rating possible, a 5-star rating, which further supports the positive sentiment of the review.

review.Review: We have been coming here about as long as it as been open and for the most part loved it. At this brunch my companion's pancakes were wonderful but I did not care for their new "creative" take on Cobb salad: iceberg lettuce without dressing, no egg, tomato and softly cooked instead of crisp bacon, etc. The ambiance continued to be its pleasant self.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'mixed' rather than strictly positive or negative. Here's why:

The review starts by saying that the reviewer has been coming to the restaurant for a long time and has generally loved it, which suggests a positive sentiment. They also mention that their companion's pancakes were "wonderful", which further reinforces the positive tone.

However, the review takes a turn when the reviewer expresses disappointment with their own dish, the "creative" take on the Cobb salad. They list several changes that they didn't like, including the absence of dressing, egg, and crisp bacon, and the use of iceberg lettuce instead of something else. This criticism is specific and detailed, and suggests that the reviewer was not satisfied with their meal.

The review ends by mentioning that the ambiance "continued to be its pleasant self", which suggests that the restaurant's atmosphere was still pleasant, at least.

Overall, while the review has both positive and negative elements, the negative comments are more specific and detailed, which gives them more weight. However, the reviewer does not use strong language to express their dissatisfaction, and they do not say that they will never return to the restaurant again, which suggests that they may still have a positive overall impression of the place.

review.Review: This was a great find! We were so happy that they could accommodate our group of 10, which is hard to find in NYC. Most of us ordered different items from the menu and we ALL felt the food was spectacular. The staff was wonderful and had assured us that they could get us served and out of the restaurant so that we could meet our tour guide. They succeeded and we never felt rushed. I would HIGHLY recommend North Square!! Can't wait to go back!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as **POSITIVE**.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses extremely positive language to describe their experience, such as "great find", "happy", "spectacular", "wonderful", and "HIGHLY recommend". They also mention specific strengths of the restaurant, such as accommodating a large group, serving a variety of dishes, and not making them feel rushed. The reviewer's enthusiasm and eagerness to return to the restaurant ("Can't wait to go back!") further reinforces the positive sentiment of the review.

review.Review: We've been having dinner at North Square for years and it has never disappointed. Additionally, when we treat our friends to dinner here, they enjoy it equally and express some surprise that they hadn't been before. We call it an "adult" restaurant. No screaming hipsters here, thank Bacchus. Very nice menu, great drinks, quiet music and quiet patrons. It's a favorite dinner destination, to be sure.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The sentiment of the review is overwhelmingly positive due to the use of words and phrases that convey a sense of satisfaction, comfort, and appreciation. The reviewer states that the restaurant "has never disappointed" and that their friends also enjoy it, expressing surprise that they hadn't been there before. The reviewer also uses positive adjectives such as "nice", "great", and "quiet" to describe the menu, drinks, music, and atmosphere. Additionally, they explicitly state that it's a "favorite dinner destination". The only slightly negative comment is a fleeting one, "No screaming hipsters here, thank Bacchus", which is more of a humorous aside than a serious criticism. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and celebratory, and the 5-star rating reinforces the positive sentiment.

review.Review: North Square was quite the pleasant surprise.  with minimal corkage,  we were able to enjoy this fine dining yet relaxed  experience for a reasonable price. Food choices had something for everyone, including house made ice cream to accompany a walnut apple tore for dessert.  Service was outstanding;  just the right amount of coverage without being overbearing. Besides the perfectly cooked rack of lamb and hi-grade tuna,  we found the salads and appetizers to be enjoyable as well.  To quote Arnold, 'We'll be back!'

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses strong positive language to describe their experience at North Square. They call it a "pleasant surprise" and state that the food choices had something for everyone. They also specifically praise the service, saying it was "outstanding" and just the right amount. Additionally, they mention that the food was delicious, highlighting the perfectly cooked rack of lamb, high-grade tuna, and enjoyable salads and appetizers. The reviewer even quotes Arnold Schwarzenegger's famous line "We'll be back!", which is a strong indication of their enthusiasm and satisfaction. The only potential criticism is the use of the phrase "reasonable price", which could imply that the reviewer didn't find the prices to be exceptional, but overall the tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: The  food is fresh and excellent, the service friendly and efficient and most important, the noise level is considerably lower than the norm - a welcome plus!

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I classify it as 'positive'. Here's why:

* The reviewer uses superlatives such as "fresh", "excellent", and "friendly" to describe the food and service, indicating a strong positive sentiment.
* They also mention a "welcome plus", which suggests that the noise level was a pleasant surprise, rather than a drawback.
* The reviewer gives the restaurant a perfect score of 5, which indicates a very high level of satisfaction.

Overall, the review is extremely positive, highlighting the restaurant's strengths and expressing no negative sentiments or criticisms.

review.Review: I love North Square and the lounge attached. I've been going there since my Art History class stayed in the hotel years ago. Moderately priced food, great happy hours, and a warm staff make the place a joy every time.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as **positive**.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses strong affirmative language to express their love for the restaurant, mentioning that it's a "joy every time" they visit. They also highlight several positive aspects, such as:

* "I love North Square and the lounge attached"
* "Great happy hours"
* "Warm staff"
* "Moderately priced food"

Additionally, the reviewer mentions experiencing a positive association with the restaurant, dating back to a memorable visit during their Art History class years ago. The only potential drawback mentioned is the price, but the reviewer characterizes it as "moderately priced", which implies that it's reasonable and not a significant issue. Overall, the review has a overwhelmingly positive tone.

review.Review: Cannot count the number of times I've been here and it never fails!  I love North Square. It's such an adult place to dine.  For those who comment about the "gray heads" who generally are the clientele, tough!  As one reviewer noted, there are plenty of places for the young and supposedly "hip" to go to in this city.  My  thirty-something daughters love this place!  North Square is a sophisticated restaurant without being pretentious.  And, oh yes, the food is superb, service excellent.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason is that the reviewer uses extremely positive language throughout the review, such as "Cannot count the number of times I've been here and it never fails", "I love North Square", "superb", and "excellent". The reviewer also mentions specific aspects of the restaurant that they enjoy, such as the sophisticated atmosphere and the food and service being top-notch. Additionally, the reviewer seems to be addressing a potential criticism of the restaurant (being geared towards an older clientele) and actively defends it, which suggests that they value the unique character of the restaurant and don't want to see it changed to appeal to a different demographic. Overall, the tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive and enthusiastic.

review.Review: This is a wonderful small neighborhood place that never disappoints.  I have been coming for years, especially with small groups when I want to be able to dine quietly. The food is great; the service attentive; and they even have a bargain prix-fixe every night--a three-course dinner for $40.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

Reason: The reviewer uses very positive language throughout the review, such as "wonderful", "never disappoints", "great", "attentive", and "bargain". They also specifically mention the restaurant's strengths, including the good food, attentive service, and reasonable pricing. The reviewer's overall sentiment is one of enthusiasm and satisfaction, which is reflected in their 5-star rating.

review.Review: It was a truly nice restaurant with a neighborhood feel. There was no trouble hearing each other (as can be the case in NYC) or listening to the specials offered for the evening. The wine list was okay, we would have preferred more choices by the glass but after speaking to the wine expert decided on a lightly-oaked California Chardonnay which went with our meal superbly. Started with a trio of appetizers which included some smoky duck (good), tuna tartare (best) and a forgetable something else (not so hot), all around good but the third left us wanting. Entrees were cooked to perfection, my partner had the Lobster and I, the Yellowfin Tuna - both wonderful. Skipped dessert and coffee because no matter how good they might have been  the meal left us satiated and we didn't want to overdo. Try this place, you'll like it.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

My reason for classification is that the reviewer mentions several positive aspects of their dining experience. They describe the restaurant as "truly nice" with a "neighborhood feel", which suggests a pleasant atmosphere. They also mention that the food was cooked to perfection and that the wine they chose paired well with their meal. The reviewer was particularly fond of two of the three appetizers and their entrees, saying they were "wonderful". The only negative comment is minor, mentioning that one of the appetizers was "not so hot", but this is quickly forgotten in their otherwise glowing review. Overall, the reviewer seems to have had a very enjoyable experience and recommends others try the restaurant, which suggests a positive sentiment.

review.Review: I usually go to North Square for their outstanding Jazz brunch so when I was meeting a casual business lunch in the Village area I decided to try North Square.  So glad I did! The ambiance is always very nice. The menu for lunch includes a 2 coarse prix fix for only $22!!  The food is just wonderful! Imaginative but not too crazy! I had soft shell crab served over greens with a light dressing.  If you are in The Village this is a must try(or always go to!) place!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

My reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses very positive language throughout the review. They mention that they "so glad" they decided to try North Square, which indicates that they were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed their experience. They also describe the ambiance as "always very nice" and the food as "wonderful", "imaginative", and "just right" (referring to the menu). The reviewer even goes as far as to say that this is a "must try(or always go to!) place", which suggests that they would highly recommend it to others. Additionally, the reviewer gives the highest rating of 5 stars, indicating that they were extremely satisfied with their experience. Overall, the review is filled with positive adjectives and phrases, indicating a very positive sentiment.

review.Review: The most civilized and comfortable restaurant in GV .  No pretensions, just good food, good service and  conversations still at low level.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

Here's why:

* The reviewer explicitly states that it is "the most civilized and comfortable restaurant in GV", which is a strong praise.
* They highlight the three key aspects of their dining experience: "good food", "good service", and "conversations still at low level" (implying that the atmosphere is pleasant and conducive to conversation). All three aspects are positively framed.
* The reviewer also mentions that there are "no pretensions", which suggests that the restaurant is genuine and doesn't try to fake sophistication, another positive characteristic.

The fact that the reviewer gives a 5-star rating also reinforces the positive sentiment. Overall, the review is glowing and enthusiastic, indicating a highly positive experience at the restaurant.

review.Review: Sunday afternoons, you'll find a $20. amazing menu and great vocal jazz in the downstairs room at North Square. Washington Square Park is across the street.  Sunday afternoons the area is hopping with music and summer vibes. 12 noon brunch and music begin and there's a second set at 2:15 pm. for those who sleep late...

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'. The reasons are:

Overall, the review is very positive and enthusiastic, with no negative comments or criticisms mentioned.

review.Review: Loved this place. Staff was lovely. Very accommodating.  It was early so the noise level was low and food was delicious.  Tuna was outstanding. Looking forward to going back.

I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Had a delightful early dinner with my nephew before going uptown to the theater. I enjoyed the scallops. They are the best. My nephew had a meat dish which he thoroughly enjoyed. Looking forward to a return visit.

I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Everything was perfect: we started out in the bar, every drink was delicious, perfectly executed, and the bartenders were very nice. The appetizers, main dishes, and deserts were delicious; the staff could not have been more attentive, the entire evening was perfect.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as **positive**. They also give the highest rating possible (5 out of 5). The reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and encouraging, suggesting that they had an outstanding experience at the restaurant.

review.Review: I went to the hear the always wonderful Roz Corral for Sunday Jazz Brunch.   The brunch pre fixe was a nice option and my omelette was delicious.  I love the bread basket with an assortment of baked items that comes with each brunch.  Service was attentive and friendly.   The music was outstanding, featuring some of the best jazz artists anywhere.  I think this is one of the nicest brunch options in the city!

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'. Here's why:

review.Review:
I chose this primarily because of it's location - where I was meeting my son after his seminar at NYU - as well as for it's quiet rating as he is hard of hearing and specifically requested a quiet table.

They obliged me with a table upfront - and it was relatively quiet. There still is modest music coming from a speaker and the close tables contribute, but it was fine.

The service was great - not intrusive but keeping tabs on us.  The food was wonderful - we did a prix fixe and both ordered different items which were very good.

I ordered the soft shell crab, cod and bread pudding - and enjoyed all of them.  To be honest, can't remember what my son ordered, but he loved the cheesecake.

Beforehand, waiting for him, I sat at the bar - and talked to the bartender who was incredibly knowledgeable about the seasonal beers and new drinks people were ordering.

Overall, a wonderful evening and we'll be back.

positive_comments.analysis: I classify this review as 'positive'. The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses mostly positive adjectives to describe their experience, such as "wonderful", "great", and "incredibly knowledgeable". They mention specific aspects of their meal that they enjoyed, such as the soft shell crab, cod, and bread pudding, as well as the service and atmosphere. They also mention that they will be back, which indicates that they were satisfied with their experience and would recommend the restaurant. The only potential criticism mentioned is the presence of background music, but the reviewer notes that it was not overwhelming and didn't detract from their experience. Overall, the review is very positive and highlights the reviewer's enjoyment of their meal and time at the restaurant.

review.Review: I'm not sure why this place isn't frequented by more young people. That food was DELICIOUS and service was great. I found there to be many older aged people there, however I loved my meal and had a very nice time!

review.Review: It is not so easy to find a restaurant for a group of eight seeing a play at  NYU's  Skirball Center.  North Square did the job very well for us.  We got a table in a back room where we could sit comfortably and talk. The food was entirely satisfactory if not sensational (particularly when we stuck to the simpler items),  and the service was friendly. The waitress was very nice to our nine-year-old  guest -- admittedly a well-behaved foodie -- and we finished in time to get to the play.  We will certainly return there when we are in that part of town again.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: We opted for a late lunch and had a window seat with a few other tables finishing their meals when we arrived. Our first impression was not all that positive. First of all, the hostess needs a personality. She half heartedly, and without so much as a smile, offered seating options in a wide open dining room. My companion was taking a phone call in the vestibule and while there had to assist elderly patrons to exit the restaurant. All the while the hostess looked on without lifting a finger or afterwards so much as offering a thank you for assisting.  Fortunately the dining experience improved. Our waiter was generally attentive, courteous and efficient. We had the crab cakes, a pork porterhouse sandwich and a duck confit salad and two glasses of wine. What I loved was the fresh ingredients and the mostly salad and veggie accompaniments vs. French fries, rice, and potatoes. The crab cakes were particularly notable but could be improve with a bit of citrus based accompaniment, even a bit more of the existing accompaniment would have improved what was a good choice. The Duck Confit salad was also good but the duck bits were a bit flat in flavor and changing this would make an otherwise good salad into a great salad. The pork sandwich was perhaps the disappointment of the meal as it sounded great on paper but was a bit lackluster in flavor. I am not sure if it is a function of the need to appeal to a wide range of palates why some of the flavors were so muted or if it was a function of our seating being close to the end of the lunch service. Getting our check seemed to be a deer in headlights inspiring experience for the staff member whom we had to draw away from some screen at the hostess station; she seemed visibly annoyed at having to do anything for the restaurant’s guests. Finally we virtually showed ourselves out without a departing thank you while the staff congregated in the rear.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'negative' with a mix of both positive and negative comments.

My reason for classification is that the review starts on a negative note, criticizing the hostess's lack of personality and lack of assistance when the reviewer's companion helped elderly patrons. The reviewer also mentions that the hostess didn't even offer a thank you. Although the reviewer praises the fresh ingredients and attentive waiter, the meal itself receives mixed reviews. The crab cakes and duck confit salad were good, but the pork sandwich was a disappointment due to its lack of flavor. The reviewer's criticisms of the hostess's attitude at the end, as well as the fact that they had to show themselves out without a departing thank you, reinforce the negative sentiment.

The positive comments are somewhat mitigated by the negative issues mentioned, resulting in a overall rating of 3 stars, which is considered mediocre.

review.Review:
We had a nice dinner at this lower ground medium sized restaurant at the northwest corner of Washington  Square. We had the address listed as 103 Waverly place which is a hotel so we assumed it was the entrance and the concierge directed us through the corridors. We noticed once in the restaurant that the entrance to the restaurant is on McDougal, around the corner from Waverly Place.
The atmosphere was cozy. Our waiter gave us a choice of table and we enjoyed a nice dinner.
For appetizer we had fried calamari with a small side of slightly spicy tomato sauce which was good. For entree we had roasted duck and grilled red snapper over a bed of vegetables. Both entrees were delicious. They had several desserts from which we chose a chocolate mousse with dark chocolate ice cream ball equally delicious.
Through the dinner the service was very good.
The decor is art deco like, very nice.
I will certainly recommend this place to anybody looking for good dinner a reasonable price in a nice environment.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'Positive'.

My reason for classifying it as positive is that the reviewer uses overwhelmingly positive language to describe their experience. They mention that the atmosphere was "cozy", their waiter was attentive and gave them a choice of table, and that the food was "good", "delicious", and "equally delicious". They also mention that the service was "very good" and that the decor was "nice". The only potential negative point mentioned is that they initially got directions wrong and had to navigate through corridors, but even this is presented as a minor hiccup. The reviewer concludes by saying that they will certainly recommend the restaurant to others, which further reinforces their positive sentiment. The 4-star rating also suggests a high level of satisfaction. Overall, the review is extremely positive and recommends the restaurant.

review.Review: The gourmet food, the outstanding wine, the attentive service, the fresh flowers, the whole ambiance,  all the BEST!

positive_comments.analysis:

The use of all capital letters in "all the BEST" further emphasizes the reviewer's excitement and satisfaction. Additionally, the five-star rating provides concrete evidence of the reviewer's high praise. The tone is overwhelmingly positive, with no negative or critical comments mentioned.

review.Review: I have found a new steady.  Went for dinner on Saturday - got a table for 5 with no problem, and everything we ordered was very good - excellent.  My friends all had oysters (I can't comment, but they seemed happy) and then a few apps.  I know the tuna tartare was delicious.  My mushroom ravioli thing was fine, although I was jealous of the tuna app, and regretted not having ordered the butter/radicchio salad w/cheese that I had considered, once I tasted that.  Several of us had the steak, which was tender and buttery, and for me that more than made up for the excess of pepper in my first bite.  But I'm not a huge pepper fan, and I much preferred the mustard that came on the side  (and the big fat steak fries were just the way I like them).   My friend was very happy with her duck entree and we shared some desserts but I was so full at that point I only had a bite or two.   We were all full but the desserts were finished.   Oh, the Sancerre by the glass was excellent.  Not inexpensive overall ($300 for 5 including 2 bottles of wine, before tip),  but a great location and WONDERFUL service.  Definitely recommend.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'. Here's why:

The review is extremely optimistic and uses many positive words to describe the dining experience, such as "excellent", "very good", "delicious", "tender", "buttery", "WONDERFUL", and "Definitely recommend". The reviewer also mentions specific dishes that they enjoyed, including the oysters, tuna tartare, mushroom ravioli, steak, and duck entree. They also appreciate the service, location, and value for money (though they do note that it was expensive).

The only mildly negative comment in the review is the reviewer's dislike of pepper, but they mention that it was just a personal preference and didn't detract from their overall enjoyment of the meal.

The reviewer gives the restaurant a perfect rating of 5 out of 5, which further supports the classification of the review as 'positive'.
