review.Review:
I come here often.  The food is good, well-prepared, fairly priced, and it's a good local spot to meet neighborhood friends for dinner.  My one complaint is that the staff are a little over eager when it comes to taking your order, taking away your dishes, and collecting the check;  I often feel rushed, even when it's not particularly crowded.  

To those reviewers who have noted, rather snidely, that North Square draws an older crowd -- get over it already; you didn't invent going out and having a good time.  If all you want is to be seen with your own precious little demographic, there are plenty of other places that will accommodate you until you age out yourselves.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive' because despite mentioning a few negative aspects (the staff being too eager and making the reviewer feel rushed), the reviewer praises the food, prices, and atmosphere of the restaurant ("good, well-prepared, fairly priced, and a good local spot"). They also directly address other negative reviews, implying that they disagree with the criticism and find the restaurant to be a welcoming and enjoyable place to spend time.

review.Review: I attend the jazz brunch to hear the always wonderful Roz Corral singing with her band of world class musicians in this intimate setting.  The brunch is always good, with a nice assortment of breads and muffins starting the meal.  The brunch tasting menu is great and I had an omelette with the choice of two fillings, served with a nicely dressed side of greens and home fries.  Service is one of the weaker points in this experience, with inconsistent refill of coffee and water.  Overall, this is a great place to have brunch and hear some outstanding music.

positive_comments.analysis: I classify this review as 'positive' with a brief reason being that the reviewer praises the music, the brunch options, and the overall experience. They specifically mention that the singer and musicians are "always wonderful", the brunch is "good", and the brunch tasting menu is "great". Although they mention that the service has some weaknesses (inconsistent refill of coffee and water), this criticism is relatively minor compared to the many positive points mentioned in the review. The reviewer also notes that it's a "great place to have brunch and hear some outstanding music", further emphasizing their positive sentiment.

review.Review: We took advance of the 3-course Restaurant Week lunch special as part of a day of wedding dress shopping. We were seated promptly at 1:30 and were able to order an off-menu bottle of cava for our table. Three out of four of us started with the butternut squash soup and we all agreed that it was very under seasoned, as though they forgot to add salt and pepper. Despite the initial let down of the soup, the following two courses more than made up for it. The scallop entree was perfectly cooked and all three dessert options were fantastic.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive' because despite mentioning a negative aspect of the meal (the lack of seasoning in the butternut squash soup), the reviewer states that it was "more than made up for" by the rest of the meal, specifically the scallop entree and the dessert options, which were all "fantastic". Its a challenge to find a good Sunday brunch place by NYU that takes reservation....check.
Good food, great service and the best blood orange tea - ever. Good blood orange mimosa too. 
I had the lobster and crab cake with an asian seaweed salad, others had omlettes - all good. Service was great, nice bread basket.......And Jazz that started at 1230, so we arrived at noon to have some quiet time.  It was great fun and easy to talk even while the trio played (sorry).
Highly rec.

And excellent wines by the glass on offer.

review.Review: The lounge is cozy and has a good choice of small plates to have with drinks (as well as the restaurant menu). Lamb sliders, fried calimari, a good tapas platter for 2 or 3 people.  Sometimes you have to ask the waiter to turn down the music, but he's pretty cheerful about it.  Cocktails are not consistent from barkeep to barkeep, though.  I've had a delicious, creamy whisky sour and a dreadful, watery one here;  I usually love the kir royales but I once had to tell the bartender how to make one.

review.Review: I have the pleasure of dining at North Square whenever my relatives stay at the Washington Square Hotel. I have been going there for years and I have to say, the food is consistently wonderful. They serve the very best olives in the city with bread at the table for a little bite and have a beautiful selection of salads and entrees--the menu is designed so thoughtful that many of the flavors from one course prepare the palate perfectly for the next. I love the arctic char with the slow roasted tomatoes. For a treat, have the gluten free and vegan pear crumble, it tastes like home. The North Square is a New York institution in my mind and I hope it never changes.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The review is overwhelmingly positive, with the reviewer using superlatives such as "wonderful", "best", and "beautiful" to describe their dining experience. The only potential criticism is the 4-star rating, which suggests that the reviewer didn't find the experience perfect, but overall the tone of the review is extremely positive.

review.Review: My husband and I were loooking for a restaurant near Washington Square, since we had tickets to an off-Broadway performance on MacDougal Street. review.Review: Our table thought the food was quite good, everyone was pleased with appetizers, entrees and desserts.  The service was unfriendly and for the most part absentee. Given that the atmosphere is dated and worn, the restaurant can't have a second strike against it, especially given that service should be an easy fix.  Right now, the place only has its food going for it and I have too many choices to feel compelled to return to a place where we were summarily dismissed.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review:
There is something nice about this place and also something odd. On the one hand you have very attractive people welcoming you on the other hand i could not work out who was managing the place.
The food was probably better than the 3 stars but we all suffered from salt overdose later and were all drinking water like mad.
Chefs should realise that 1990s methods of flavouring have moved on and salt should be on the table not in the food.
We were well served but it was very stilted. If I was the owner I would be worried about the loose canons being left to their own devices.
I felt they were more busy doing things than caring for us.
In short a clunky heavy handed experience but the quality of the food was good marred only by the saltiness .

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as "mixed" or "neutral", but leaning towards being "negative" overall.

The reviewer starts by mentioning something "nice" about the place, which suggests that there are some positive aspects. They also mention that the food was "probably better than the 3 stars", implying that the cuisine was good. However, the reviewer then lists several criticisms, including the excessive use of salt, poor service, and an overall feeling of being overwhelmed.

Despite mentioning some positive qualities, the majority of the review focuses on the negatives, with phrases like "there is something odd", "could not work out who was managing the place", and "loose canons being left to their own devices". The reviewer even states that they would be "worried about the loose canons being left to their own devices" if they were the owner, which suggests that they have serious concerns about the establishment.

Overall, while the reviewer does acknowledge some good qualities, the criticisms and negative comments outweigh the positives, leading me to classify the review as leaning towards being "negative".

review.Review: Celebrated a birthday with a special someone & it was great! The staff smiled and were very welcoming. The jazz band actually gave us a shout out during their amazing performance. The food came out on time and we made new friends in the crowd. Although there was no dance floor we stood up and danced to our requested song "At last" & everyone enjoyed themselves. (Yes, the band and Laura, Paul, and Kevin took our request!!! :-). review.Review: Travelling on business, I chose this restaurant because it was convenient. I was beyond pleased. I had the filet au poivre and frites. It was prepared perfectly and the au jus was so tasty. It came with roasted Vidalia onions which I gobbled up because I am a fool for Vidalias. The potatoes were so-so but didn't detract greatly from the meal. I wish I had room for dessert since the selections looked wonderful.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

dinner service to be a little slow on several occasions. Overall NS feels like a Secret Neighborhood Treasure.

REDECORATED

review.Review:
The food is excellent. Many classic dishes with a contemporary twist, preparation outstanding. Everything is made with care and attention, and therefore delicious. The rack of lamb was perfectly seasoned, pink inside, just as it should be. Potato galette was also perfect: full of flavor, not heavy of fatty. My dining companion had the short ribs -- absolutely no fat (not easy with short ribs), in a richly flavored sauce with ancho chili and other mysterious flavors -- cinnamon? Delicious.
Best of all: it's quiet! You can hear whoever is on the other side of the table and have a conversation. Music is muted classic jazz, staff is friendly, relaxed and efficient.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as **positive**. Here's why:

* The reviewer uses superlatives such as "excellent", "outstanding", "perfectly seasoned", "delicious", and "absolutely no fat" to describe the food and service.
* The reviewer highlights specific dishes as being well-prepared, including the rack of lamb, potato galette, and short ribs.
* The reviewer also praises the ambiance, mentioning that the restaurant is "quiet" and that they can have a conversation with their companion, which is a relief from loud background noise.
* The music and staff are also described as being pleasant, with the reviewer noting that the music is "muted classic jazz" and the staff is "friendly, relaxed, and efficient".
* Although the reviewer gave a 4-star rating (out of 5), the tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive, with no criticisms or negative comments.

Overall, the reviewer's glowing praise for the food, service, and ambiance suggests a high level of satisfaction and enthusiasm, leading me to classify the review as positive.

review.Review: We live around the corner and we eat here regularly. Terrific food, with something for everyone. Friendly and professional service. Short ribs are outstanding and the coriander crusted tuna is memorable. Fantastic desserts!

review.Review: I always come to hear the wonderful Roz Coral and her trio on Sundays for brunch. The food is consistently good and well presented. The price is fair and you can't beat the high quality musicianship. This is one of the nicest jazz brunches in NYC and I highly recommend North Square.

review.Review: I made a business lunch reservation for ten and received the slowest service throughout the experience. The venue seemed understaffed delaying every aspect of the service. They were slow in putting bread on the table, taking our order and getting the food on the table. The group was so hungry the bread bowl was empty within minutes yet never replenished. The food was wonderful and so is the decor of the restaurant. But overall, the service needed improvement. What made the afternoon worse was the insensitivity of the waitstaff. No one came over to explain the delays. After everyone was finally served, I politely mentioned it to the server, who offered a defensive explanation but nothing more. Not good for business!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'negative'.

The reason for my classification is that the reviewer mentions several negative aspects of their experience, including:

* Slow service, which affected every aspect of their dining experience
* Understaffing, which led to delays in receiving food and service
* Inadequate replenishment of bread, leaving the group hungry
* Insensitivity of the waitstaff, who failed to explain delays and offered a defensive explanation instead of apologizing or providing a solution

The only positive aspects mentioned are the food, which was described as "wonderful", and the decor of the restaurant. Staff was on point and quite friendly...We got a mini tour of the establishment and I was impressed w/ how kind and professional the guys @ North Square are...thx for a wonderful dining experience...and we shall return

review.Review: North Square is a wonderful restaurant for those who want to have reliably very good food in a peaceful, relaxing environment. review.Review: The one saving grace about our experience was Rick the bartender. We should have stayed at the bar instead of being sat at our table. Our table for two was in between tables of parties four. The food was average. What really disappointed us was that at end of dinner I was charged extra for a glass wine that was not ordered. They did fix that, but when checking my bank account the next day I was not only charged for half the bill I shared with my partner, but also I was double charged for the whole bill. We also wondered where our waitress went because at the end of night, the bus boy was taking care of us. Let's just say we will not be returning here again.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify the sentiment of this review as 'negative'.

The main reason for this classification is the abundance of criticisms and complaints mentioned in the review. The reviewer mentions several issues with their experience, including:

* Poor table placement, which made for an uncomfortable dining experience
* Average food
* Unexpected and unexplained extra charge for a glass of wine
* Errors in charging for the bill, with the reviewer being charged twice for the whole bill and half of the bill
* Absence of their waitress at the end of the night, with the bus boy taking care of them instead

The reviewer's tone is also critical and disappointed, with a clear intention to express their dissatisfaction and warn others against returning to the establishment. review.Review: I attended the jazz brunch to hear one of my favorite performers, Roz Corral. Unfortunately, things got off to a shaky start at reception, when we found the music area was fully seated. I made this request clear on my Opentable reservation note as requested by the restaurant. The man at check in gave me a semi lecture about making a special call ahead to reserve as they had so many reservations. Really? I thought that was the purpose of the "notes" section. In any event, the brunch was tasty as always. I love the bread basket with the cranberry nut bread and other assorted goodies. My omelette was cooked to order with a delicious salad. Service was just ok, and appeared disorganized. As always, the music was outstanding!

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'negative' with a neutral undertone.

The review starts with a negative tone, mentioning that the jazz brunch got off to a "shaky start" due to misunderstandings about reservations. The reviewer expresses frustration with the staff's response, feeling that the "notes" section on OpenTable was not taken seriously. Although they mention that the food was "tasty as always", the service was only "just ok" and seemed to be "disorganized". However, the reviewer praises the music as "outstanding", which adds a positive note to the review.

The overall sentiment is negative because the reviewer was clearly dissatisfied with the service and the initial issues with reservations. However, the inclusion of positive comments about the food and music suggests that the reviewer did not entirely hate their experience, hence the neutral undertone. The 3-star rating also indicates a middle-of-the-road assessment, which confirms the mixed sentiment.

review.Review: Food was blsh! Had sausage appetizer which looked like, 6 plain dry breakfast sausages on a plate, the side sauce had some flavor so you had to smother the sausage in it. The review started by saying "I had a great time" which implies a strong positive sentiment. The reviewer also mentioned that the food was "done delicious" (likely meant to say "was delicious") which further emphasizes the positive tone. Additionally, the service was praised as "great" and the whole experience was found to be "lovely" and "comfortable".

The only minor negative comment is about the decor being "not as fancy", but it does not seem to have a significant impact on the overall sentiment of the review. Overall, the review is overwhelmingly positive.

Classification: Positive

review.Review: Went here for valentines dinner. The lobster/crab cake with seaweed salad was great, the Quail appetizer was great, and both entrees (filet and lamb) were great, all at a reasonable price. The atmosphere was quiet -- a plus in my book, but it may be a little too quiet for some -- it's generally an older crowd, and I wouldn't call it a hip spot. The only real negative was the slow service. Everyone was pleasant, they were just a little slow and perhaps overwhelmed.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive' overall. Here's why:

* The reviewer uses superlatives such as "great" to describe the food they ordered, which suggests they thoroughly enjoyed their meal.
* They mention that the price was "reasonable", which implies that the value for money was good.
* The only negative comment is about the slow service, but the reviewer frames it as a minor issue and mentions that the staff were pleasant, which suggests it was not a major problem.
* The reviewer highlights the quiet atmosphere as a positive aspect, indicating that they appreciated the intimate setting.

The only reason this review isn't entirely 'positive' is due to the slow service, which is why the reviewer gave it a 4-star rating rather than a 5-star. However, the positives outweigh the negative, leading me to classify the review as overall positive.

review.Review: I eat here at least one night while staying at the adjoining Washington Square Hotel. The food is always good and priced reasonably. There are always locals who dine a the hotel frequently, many on a first name basis with the hotel staff. This is definitely a good option for anyone looking for a restaurant near Washington Square.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer mentions several positive aspects of the restaurant, including:

* "The food is always good"
* "Priced reasonably"
* "Locals who dine here frequently"
* "Many on a first name basis with the hotel staff", which implies a welcoming and friendly atmosphere

The only reason this review is not considered 'excellent' or 'perfect' is the 4-star rating, which suggests that the reviewer had no major complaints, but may have had some minor issues or areas for improvement. Overall, the tone of the review is positive and encouraging.

review.Review: Whenever a friend visits New York City asking for a restaurant that provides really great seasonal food I think of North Square. The wait staff is attentive without being overwhelming. The menu is always interesting and tasty. This NYC gem is a perfect example of how New American Cuisine is influenced by the multitude of immigrants that have graced our shores. I can't wait for my next meal there.

positive_comments.analysis:
Based on the review, I classify it as 'positive'.

My reason for this classification is that the reviewer mentions several positive aspects of North Square, such as:

* The restaurant provides "really great seasonal food"

* The reviewer expresses enthusiasm for their next meal there, saying "I can't wait"

The only potential negative aspect mentioned is that the reviewer doesn't give a perfect rating (4 out of 5), but overall, the tone of the review is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: was one of eight women to celebrate a birthday. Service was very, very, very slow. Had to ask for table to be cleared. Ordered ice coffee didnt arrive but was on check. review.Review: Came here with 2 friends for brunch. THe service was excellent and they accommodated for some special dietary restrictions with ease. The brunch tasting was awesome and gave a variety of foods. The chicken apple sausage is excellent to be sure to order that. The ambiance is rather plain, but fine. I was happy that is was a quiet and comfortable atmosphere despite being full so that I could still here my friends talk. With great food and service, I would definitely come back!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: North Square has been one of our go-to restaurants for years. It has consistently great food, the prices are moderate, and the service is excellent. The wine list is interesting and well-priced. It's also a place where you don't have to stain to hear your dinner companions.

review.Review: If you have never heard of North Square but you just discovered how wonderful it is, don't tell anyone. If you do, it will be packed and we will never be able to get in again. Delicious food, great wine list and an attentive, thoughtful staff make this an absolute perfect place for a quiet dinner with someone special...but please don't tell anyone!

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses very positive adjectives to describe the restaurant, such as "wonderful", "delicious", "great", and "attentive". The only "negative" sentiment in the review is the humorous warning to keep the restaurant a secret to avoid it getting too crowded, but this is not a genuine criticism of the restaurant itself, but rather a playful suggestion. Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and positive, indicating a high level of satisfaction with their dining experience.

review.Review: Enjoyed a relaxing and unhurried dinner with a friend. We were able to talk without straining ears or voice...very civilized...and the food was terrific! We had excellent salads and I had the salmon which was fresh and perfectly cooked as requested. Side dishes of spinach and garlic and herbed queonia were very good...as was the bread. We enjoyed everything and will recommend it to my older friends who want a lovely low key place to dine.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as "Positive".

The reasons for this classification are:

* The reviewer uses positive adjectives such as "relaxing", "unhurried", "civilized", and "terrific" to describe their experience.
* They mention that the food was "excellent" and specifically praise the salmon, spinach, garlic and herbed quinoa, and bread, saying that they were all "very good".
* They express satisfaction with the service, stating that they were able to talk without difficulty, which implies that the noise level was pleasant.

Overall, the reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, and they highlight several aspects of their experience that they enjoyed.

review.Review: North Square is a good lunch place. The food is good, pretty light and nicely varied. Best not to be from NYU or you may run into everyone you know. Service is efficient and unobtrusive. Noise level, at least in front, is low. If you get there early they have a few booths in back and I think one can reserve one when making a reservation, although you may need three people.

review.Review: As always. Plenty of choices, beautifully prepared, and spot on service. Waiter also steered me to a better wine pairing than what I had ordered.

The only potentially negative aspect of the review is the brevity of the review, but since the reviewer is generally quite positive, I wouldn't consider this to be a negative sentiment overall.

review.Review: Had never been to North Square before, but heard good things about their Thanksgiving dinner. We had about a 10 minute wait for our table in the very narrow, crowded dining room. The whole restaurant was clean, simply decorated, modern looking. My husband hated it! However when we were to be seated, we were directed out the front door and up the street to the Washington Square Hotel entrance, through the lobby and into the old-fashioned, dark-panelled barroom! Quite a strange set-up. My husband loved it, me less so. But the food was very good with many options besides turkey, plus we had comfortable seats and plenty of room. At $55 prix fix for appetizer, entree, dessert and coffee, a very good value.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive' with a neutral/ mixed sentiment tone.

Here's why:

* The reviewer mentions that the food was "very good" with many options, which is a positive comment.
* They also mention that the value was "very good" with a prix fixe menu at $55 for four courses.
* However, they express mixed sentiments about the restaurant's setup, with their husband loving it and the reviewer themselves being less enthusiastic. This neutral comment does not outweigh the positive comments about the food and value.
* The reviewer's tone is casual and matter-of-fact, without any strong emotions or negative language.

Overall, while the review is not entirely positive, it does highlight the strengths of the restaurant (food, value, comfortable seating) and does not contain any strongly negative language, which is why I would still classify it as 'positive'.

review.Review: We needed a quiet, pleasant place for a lunch meeting for four where the food would be good and that prices reasonable. Hit the mark on all counts.

I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The reason for this classification is that the reviewer mentions that the restaurant "hit the mark on all counts", which implies that their expectations were met and exceeded. review.Review: I eat lunch here often but maybe I'll start going more often for dinner, too. We were five people in my party and everyone loved the food. The duck got raves, my son loved his pork ribeye, and my scallops were perfectly cooked. The crab and lobster cakes were a perfect first course, and both desserts (chocolate mousse cake, spicy bread pudding) were eagerly devoured. And the bread here is always great. Plus they have a fine list of wines by the glass and pour generously. When my husband admitted that he didn't love his cocktail, the waiter immediately asked what would make it better and brought a new version (which he did indeed like better). As always in North Square the service was very pleasant but a little slow.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'. The reviewer mentions several positive experiences, including:

* Everyone in the party loved the food, with specific dishes being highlighted (duck, pork ribeye, scallops, crab and lobster cakes)
* The bread is always great
* The wine list is fine and pours generously
* The service is pleasant, although a bit slow

The one minor criticism mentioned is that the service is a bit slow, but this is not enough to detract from the overall positive tone of the review. The reviewer also mentions that the waiter addressed their husband's concern about his cocktail and brought a new version, which suggests that the restaurant is proactive in addressing customer needs. The overall tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, with the reviewer mentioning that they may start going for dinner as well as lunch.

review.Review:
Nestled on the North West corner of Washington Square Park is a little gem of a restaurant. North Square has been there it seems for
decades and yet seems to remain a neighborhood secret. The ambience is calm and seemingly unchanging, The tables are a little to close .The back room has a Jazz brunch in Sunday .The" tasting dish"on the brunch menu is quite good and as almost everything on the menu it remains one of the best bargains in NYC.
Although the serving size is not large, it always seems to be just enough to satisfy. I would like to see a few more items offered on the dinner menu, it's a little to limited for me. Following your meal walk literally across the street and you have beautified Washington Sq. Park.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reasons for my classification are:

* The reviewer describes the restaurant as a "little gem" and "one of the best bargains in NYC", which are positive adjectives.
* They mention that the ambience is "calm and seemingly unchanging", which suggests a pleasant atmosphere.
* They praise the "tasting dish" and the brunch menu, saying it's "quite good" and one of the best bargains in NYC.
* Although they mention a few minor drawbacks, such as the tables being a bit too close and the limited dinner menu, these are not enough to outweigh the positive aspects of the review.
* The reviewer concludes by mentioning the beautiful surroundings, which adds to the overall positive tone of the review.

Overall, the reviewer's comments are overwhelmingly positive, and their rating of 4 out of 5 suggests that they had a very good experience at North Square.

review.Review: We had to wait more than 20 minutes for our server to appear for the first time. It was not her fault. She was the only one on duty for a large lunch crowd. Once our order was finally placed, there was another wait, but a variety of delicious breads and mini-muffins helped quell the hunger pangs. When our entrees finally arrived, the food was nicely presented, delicious (both meals) and reasonably priced. I blame the owner or manger or whoever didn't ensure proper staffing for the busy Saturday lunch crowd, not our valiant server. I hope it was an anomaly. I'd definitely give it another chance based on the food alone.

review.Review: North Square is the perfect respite on a dark chilly evening in Washington Square offering a warm welcoming setting with a ‘speak easy’ feel. The cuisine is equally pleasing with service that is attentive but not overbearing. The entrees are presented beautifully and are just as sumptuous – we enjoyed pan-seared halibut and grilled pork rib eye which is as moist and delicious as a perfect filet mignon. There as so many excellent choices that we depended on our waiter to narrow the possibilities – he was well versed offering additional enticing details, from the wine selection to dessert. Pressed coffee is the final touch at this Village gem - also great for brunch, lunch, afternoon tea, a picnic basket for the Park – and a lounge for jazz.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

My reason for classification is that the reviewer uses overwhelmingly positive language to describe their experience at North Square. They describe the setting as "warm welcoming", the cuisine as "pleasing", and the service as "attentive" and "entertaining". They also highlight specific dishes as "sumptuous", "moist", and "delicious", and praise the waiter for being knowledgeable and helpful. review.Review: We've long liked "North Square" restaurant opposite Washington Square in Greenwich Village. Food, service, and ambience make it one of the most comfortable restaurants in New York. A group of 4 can actually have a conversation while eating - the noise level is pleasantly under control. On our most recent visit (9/6/13), low noise level and very attentive staff made us comfortable as always.. However the food seemed less fresh, less well-prepared and served compared to earlier visits. Perhaps it was the chef's night off, but the food (including the wine and the desserts) were just "off". For example the Arctic Char tasted fishy rather than fresh, and the dessert rather bland. We will certainly return, expecting better food.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'mixed' or 'neutral', rather than strictly positive or negative. Here's why:

The reviewer mentions several positive aspects of the restaurant, such as:

* They "long liked" the restaurant and consider it one of the most comfortable in New York
* The food, service, and ambiance are generally well-done
* The noise level is pleasant and allows for easy conversation

* The food on their recent visit was less fresh, less well-prepared, and less tasty than on previous visits

* The reviewer is disappointed but still plans to return, expecting better food in the future

The overall sentiment is neither overwhelmingly positive nor negative, as the reviewer is mixed in their assessment of the restaurant. While they were pleased with some aspects, they were also disappointed with others.

So make sure somewhere on Opentable you tell them you want the jazz brunch, or like me, you'll miss out. Sad. But the food was good and very reasonably priced.

review.Review: Our first visit to North Square was a very mixed experience. Service was friendly but poor. Although the restaurant wasn't croweded, we sat for half an hour before anyone showed up to move beyond the "Here are your menus" stage, and we were only able to place our order (for drinks *and* dinner, as a precaution) after hailing the hostess and asking her to find someone. Entrees also took too long to arrive, and the meal itself was uneven: kale salad with apples and buttermilk dressing was plentiful and delicious, the duck breast was succulent, the sauteed halibut was dry and flavorless and the vegetable accompaniments were brown and blandly prepared. The place is pretty, tables are well-spaced, but I doubt we'll be going back.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'negative'. Here's why:

Although the reviewer mentions some positive aspects, such as the service being "friendly", the overall tone of the review is critical. They highlight a number of issues with their experience, including poor service, long wait times, and issues with the food quality. In particular, the reviewer notes that some dishes were "dry and flavorless", "brown and blandly prepared", and that the service was "poor". These criticisms outweigh the few positive comments, leading me to conclude that the overall sentiment is negative.

review.Review: ALthough the location can't be beat--- right off Wasshing Square Park, and the food was good enough.... the service bordered on abysmal. Our table was tucked into a corner (which we liked), but it was nearly impossible to get the attention of a waiter, or busboy... or anyone, for that matter. The vibe was one of casual indifference. North Square lacked a soul -- there was no staff member that seemed happy enough to be serving diners, or really be bothered with any of the aspects of running a restaurant. It is a shame, since the location is great, the food is decent, and the ambience is pleasant. THis was one dining experience where the inattention and general maiaise of the staff had a negative effect on the whole night out.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review: North Square is great for listening in on delightful conversations - and none of them are on cell phones. New Yorkers tend to be opinionated and vocal and they enjoy a good Cobb salad (my husband's choice) or blueberry pear pancakes (mine). What fun to be near NYU and the park, a little oasis in the busy downtown arena.

positive_comments.analysis:

The review mentions that North Square is "great" for listening to conversations, which suggests that the reviewer enjoyed the atmosphere and ambiance of the place. The reviewer also specifically praises the quality of the food, mentioning that the Cobb salad and blueberry pear pancakes are enjoyable. Overall, the review is filled with positive language and descriptions, indicating that the reviewer had a pleasant dining experience at North Square.

review.Review:
North Square is my "go to place." I have been eating there for many years and NEVER been disappointed. The food is elegant but not fussy the wait staff is knowledgeable and has the right balance between being engaging and unobtrusive. I have brought everyone from colleagues to my young nephews (7 & 9) to my parents - no one has been disappointed. One thing I truly appreciate is that the noise level is not overpowering and the table can converse without competing with other conversations or music that is too loud.

Go - you'll certainly return!

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment Analysis: Positive

Reason: The review is extremely positive, with the reviewer stating that they have never been disappointed in their many years of dining at North Square. They also praise the food, service, and atmosphere, mentioning specific aspects they appreciate such as the balance between being engaging and unobtrusive wait staff, the noise level, and the ability to converse easily. The reviewer's enthusiasm is evident throughout the review, and they even recommend the restaurant, stating "Go - you'll certainly return!" The 5-star rating further reinforces the positive sentiment.

review.Review: Tasty food and terrific live jazz at reasonable prices makes this a super spot for brunch. We like bringing out-of-towners so the can see the Vlillage and enjoy live entertainment too.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The reviewer also expresses their enthusiasm for bringing out-of-town guests to the restaurant, implying that they would recommend it to others. review.Review: Do not hesitate to frequent this Sunday Jazz Brunch gem in the heart of Washington Square. The jazz was phenomenal, the food excellent, the prices reasonable. North Square seems to attract a smart crowd interested in quiet conversation and music for the soul . We sat in the Lounge for the jazz brunch - The Roz Corral Trio set the tone nicely and created an intimate atmosphere. Attentive and classy wait staff. No attitude here. Just a nice vibe. The prix fixe ($20) well worth every bit. Pecan pancakes made my day. Other members of my family enjoyed the Eggs Benedict and very generous pours on the Bloody Marys. Menu has great variety expertly prepared. This place is a gem; understated elegance worth every penny. I will return.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive'. The reason for this classification is that the reviewer uses overwhelmingly positive language to describe their experience at the restaurant. They use words and phrases such as "phenomenal", "excellent", "reasonable", "smart crowd", "intimate atmosphere", "attentive and classy", "nice vibe", "well worth every bit", "gem", "understated elegance", and "worth every penny" to describe the jazz, food, service, and atmosphere. They also mention specific dishes that they enjoyed, such as the pecan pancakes, Eggs Benedict, and Bloody Marys. The reviewer's gushing praise and lack of criticism or complaints suggest that they had a truly enjoyable experience and would likely return to the restaurant.

review.Review: The food was good, but the service was slow and not efficient at all. Had to call the waiter several times to order beverages. Our appetizer came first then our drinks.

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I would classify it as 'negative'. Here's my reason:

Although the reviewer mentions that the food was "good", they also highlight several significant issues with the service, which overshadow the positive aspect of the food. The slow and inefficient service, having to call the waiter multiple times to order beverages, and the inconsistency between appetizer and drink arrival times are all significant complaints. Additionally, the reviewer's overall rating of 3 out of 5 stars suggests that they were generally dissatisfied with their experience.

While the review is not completely devastating or abusive, the negative comments about the service and wait times dominate the review, making it a negative sentiment.

review.Review: Yes, it's full of senior citizens, but if you want quiet, come here. The food there is outstanding, but the service does NOT match the food. I get a feeling that they deal with so many particular, old folks that they're just tired. I mentioned in my reservation that it was my 92 year old uncles birthday. Ordered dessert and NOTHIN. You would think a restaurant of this caliber would've just done something. A candle, write on the plate in chocolate, something... Had to ask our waiter more than once for a few things, he just always seemed rushed and odd. At times he was good in suggesting menu items. I WILL be back because the food is stellar, and I love the quietness, but get it together on the service.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'mixed', but leaning towards 'negative' due to the prominent criticism of the service.

The reviewer mentions that the food is "outstanding" and they love the quiet atmosphere, which suggests positive sentiment. However, the majority of the review is dedicated to criticizing the service, stating that it doesn't match the quality of the food. They also specifically highlight several instances where they felt the service was poor, such as having to ask multiple times for things and the waiter seeming rushed and odd.

The only reason the reviewer is willing to return is due to the excellent food and quiet atmosphere, but the negative comments about the service are more prominent and influential in shaping their overall opinion. Therefore, I would classify this review as 'negative' with a rating of 3 out of 5, indicating that the reviewer had some positive experiences but was ultimately disappointed with the service.

review.Review: North Square proved to be a perfect gem for our family party of six. We had a quiet table with soft background Jazz to create a lovely, relaxing ambiance. Conversation was easy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The pace of service was not hurried and all our needs were cheerfully met. Ambiance and service aside, what made North Square so awesome was the EXTRAORDINARY food! Everything we ordered, from salads and soups to dessert was nothing short of perfection! We enjoyed options including scallops, duck, Atlantic char and yellow fin tuna. Each was exceptionally delicious and given a magnificent presentation. Add the reasonable menu pricing to complete an unbeatable dinning out experience. We will recommend and return to North Square!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review:
I cannot believe how underrated this restaurant is. The food is just amazing, and not over-priced (by Manhattan standards). And the wine list's got some really interesting, off the beaten track, picks. Who knew about the Grenache Gris grape? Who in the US carries wine from Jura (a little-known French wine region stuck between the better-known Burgundy and Alsace)?
I fully recommend that restaurant.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive'. The reviewer uses phrases such as "amazing", "fully recommend", and "who knew" to express their enthusiasm and surprise at the restaurant's quality and uniqueness. They also mention specific details about the food and wine list that impress them, such as the "interesting, off the beaten track, picks" and the unusual grape varieties carried. The tone is one of excitement and praise, with no criticism or negative comments. The only potential drawback is the reviewer's comment that the restaurant is "underrated", which could be interpreted as a negative comment, but overall the tone is overwhelmingly positive.

review.Review: We've been coming to North Square for years and have never been disappointed. The food is always innovative, service accommodating and ambiance lovely. The wine we had was really good and not overpriced. The management is very nice and always goes out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We were late for our reservation due to traffic and parking issues but they held our table and didn't make an issue of it. We will definitely keep coming back!!

review.Review: This neighborhood gem is a favorite of my aunt's so we chose to have her 90th birthday dinner here. From beginning to end we were treated with exceptional care including a lovely gesture from our server...she brought a pillow for my diminutive aunt so she could sit high enough to enjoy her meal. When our food arrived, all 5 of us just looked at it for a while. The presentation was amazing. And...it tasted better than it looked. All of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals. Thanks to Chad for and his pastry chef for the birthday cake (order 2 weeks ahead). The red velvet, chocolate mousse cake was delectable. North Square will be our "go to" restaurant every time we're in NYC. Why mess with perfection.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Very good wild mushroom soup - not too creamy, salty or fussy so the taste of the mushrooms is highlighted. NS will be on our list when we're in the Village.

review.Review:
Located right off of Washington Square, you step down into a warm and comfortable room. We were immediately seated...and waited. And waited. Once the server appeared, things got back on track. They looked delicious. Aside from the short rib being dry and the rack of lamb which was ordered medium rare, arriving well done, we enjoyed our evening. The sides were delicious and the dessert was the perfect end to the evening.
Aside from a couple missteps, we look forward to a return visit.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review: Four of had a lovely dinner at North Square. It's a neighborhood staple. The food is very good mother atmosphere & service are excellent and grown up. review.Review: I came here for brunch with my sister and had a nice time. We both ordered the brunch sampler. The chicken apple sausage with wonderful, so I would definite recommend ordering that. But there was nothing unique or particularly memorable about the food or ambiance here that would drive me to come on my own. With so many cute and unique brunches in they city, this one is fine, but nothing I would rush back to. The value here is good with a lot of food and reasonable prices.

review.Review: Although I don't live in Greenwich Village, North Square is among my favorite restaurants when I venture to this neighborhood. The food, more-or-less French in style, is very nicely prepared and beautifully presented. The service is friendly, if occasionally just a little trifle difficult to summon. The restaurant itself is very pretty, although, alas, noisier than I could wish. Overall, I always enjoy the dining experience here.

review.Review: I attended the jazz brunch to hear Roz Corral and had a wonderful afternoon. This is one of my favorite brunch spots in the city and I always look forward to a visit to North Square!

review.Review: Was seeing a show at NYU and was looking for a nice, moderately priced restaurant nearby. Found this one in Zagat and booked through Open Table. And the main courses - tuna steak for her, seared scallops for me - were both excellent. Service was very friendly but not overbearing and timing of courses was perfect. Total bill with tax and tip (neither of us had drinks) was $75. Really and excellent experience.

positive_comments.analysis:

I will keep coming back here and always bring friends.

review.Review: We dined at North Square the night of October 16 on the advice ofor firends, with whom we celebrated our 50th wedding anniversary. As our friends are from Sydney, AUS, we rarely get to see them and a quiet restaurant with excellent food was what we wished. North Square was perfect. In addition to the great food, the staff was flexible when one of our party changed his mind about his wine, and understood that our friends' son was there only for a drink and then off to work. Tow days later, my wife is still raving about the Scallops, whereas I am ecstatic about the lamb. On top of everthing else, we lingered for quite some time and di not feel rushed to leave.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review:
I've been here twice, and an definitely going to return in the future. The service is generally friendly and attentive, the wine list is well-priced and eclectic, the food ranges between "good" and "outstanding", and the ambiance is perfect for a nice, quiet dinner.

Outstanding dishes:
-Rack of Lamb (Perfectly cooked, tender. Delicious.)
-The shrimp appetizer.
-Scallop and Salmon Terrine ~~[[This was actually given as compliments of the house. Thanks!]]
-The rhubarb and strawberry crumble

Wine... Yes their wine list rocks. The markup seems to generally be ~80-100%. So that means that a $30 bottle will be $50-60. Both of the below were great.
-Reserva “Viña Bosconia” R. López de Heredia 2003
-CdP "Memora" Julien Masquin 2009

review.Review: I attended the jazz brunch to hear vocalist Roz Corral. I was very impressed with the food, service and ambience! Of course, the music was the high point of the day. If you want to hear some of New York's heavy hitters in jazz in an intimate setting, this is the place to go! I'd highly recommend North Square and look forward to my next visit to NYC.

review.Review: Great little place, fantastic service. We started with the Salmond & Scallop Terrine and the special Tomato Salad. The terrine looked a little like spam but it was fantastic. Great flavor & the jalapeno tartar sauce was very good. For dinner a few friends had the scallops, which were tasty but had a little coconut milk & I'm not crazy about fruit with my meat - but both friends loved them. Another friend had the chicken, which he said was good - but was just chicken. I had the short ribs, fork tender with great flavor - they fantastic! Everything had great presentation and attention to details. I would definitely go back again!

review.Review:
The jazz brunch is real cool. First, the space itself is lovely. Well appointed, but intimate. (There are two dining rooms - the lounge, which is more clubby, and the restaurant which feels more like an upscale diner. Wherever you are more comfortable.)

Brunch was ample for the $20. We got juice (or you can have coffee), blood orange mimosa, cheese and mushroom omelette which comes with a nice salad, home fries, and scone. Couldn't finish it all. Waitstaff was attentive.

The jazz group was quite accomplished, and the vocalist very good. We enjoyed the brunch very much.

positive_comments.analysis:

review.Review: We have been to North Square many times because the food is very good and the room is pleasant and comfortable. There was no one to easily ask for any service.

review.Review: I was at North Square once before and loved it. Thought it was one of the most enjoyable restaurant experiences ever in NYC. The food was perfect (duck, not easy to do). Traveled two hours from LI this time, and asked a collegue from abroad to join my husband and me for brunch. I wish we had gone to the diner instead!!! The omelets were over-cooked, the salad had wilted from the heat lamps (or something) and the home-fries were tasteless. I should have sent it all back. I was hoping for a nice, perfect omelet, based on my previous experience at North Square, but no. The bread was good, but I would guess, left over from dinner the night before. I will never go back.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'negative'. Here's why:

review.Review: The food was excellent and the service fine until the check arrived. review.Review: We'd been to North Square before and thought it would be a nice local place for Easter Sunday. When I made the reservation for 3:45 pm, I didn't confirm if there would be a special menu for Easter. There wasn't; at least not at 3:45. The waiter said the dinner menu was available at 5:30. We had the regular brunch menu (eggs, pancakes, etc.). We were disappointed, but made the best of it. The lobster-crab cakes were delicious as was the buccatini with chicken. Next time, I'll ask about the menu.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: My boyfriend and I went to a North Square event at the Washington Square Hotel. We go to a lot of similar events (Brooklyn Brewery does them often) and this event was shockingly awful. Completely disorganized; made people who were paying $65 per plate wait, as the event started a half hour late, without providing any drinks. The seating arrangement, once we were sitting, was such that I was elbowed in the head every 20 minutes by a waiter. There were about 45 minutes between each of the courses. What's better than waiting forever for food that is less than mediocre? Then there's the decor/ambience --- the odd IHOP-like lighting, the no music, the cramped seating. There was nothing positive about the experience here.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'negative'. The reviewer explicitly states that the event was "shockingly awful" and lists several negative aspects of their experience, including:

* Disorganization and late start
* No drinks provided
* Poor seating arrangement resulting in physical discomfort
* Long waits (45 minutes) between courses
* Unappealing decor and ambiance
* Mediocre food

The reviewer also gives the event a rating of 1 out of 5, which further supports a negative classification. The tone of the review is critical and disapproving, with no positive comments or recommendations.

review.Review: Another fine experience at our favorite mid-village restaurant. It's always good, always quiet, friendly, and reasonably priced. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary on an early Sunday night, and we were offered a nice corner table, as per our request on Open Table. Following our meal of radiccio and boston leaf salad (perfectly dressed), and a terrific roasted tomato soup with shrimp and shoestring potatoes, a mushroom tart, and one very tender short ribs, we were already satisfied without dessert. But the kitchen surprised and delighted us with lovely cookies and little glasses of champagne on the house before we left. Service was relaxed, seamless, well organized.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'positive'. The review uses numerous positive adjectives to describe the experience, such as "fine", "good", "quiet", "friendly", "reasonably priced", "perfectly dressed", "terrific", "lovely", and "seamless". The reviewer also mentions specific items they enjoyed, such as the radiccio and boston leaf salad, roasted tomato soup, mushroom tart, and short ribs. The reviewer also expresses satisfaction and delight with the surprise cookies and champagne offered at the end of the meal. The only potential drawback mentioned is that the dessert was not needed, but this is presented as a positive, as it shows that the reviewer was already full and sated. Overall, the review is glowing and suggests that the reviewer had an excellent experience at the restaurant.

review.Review: Happy to have discovered this comfortable neighborhood gem. Dined during Restaurant Week, but regular menue appears quite reasonable. Each of the four of us was very happy with his/her selection. No one rushed us, and noise level allowed for conversation Imagine that! Will defintely return and definitely have the homemade donuts.

review.Review: A surprising find, this one. The decor is more 1980 than 2012 but the food and the cooking were pretty good. We went during NYC restaurant week. Unlike our other restaurant week choice, they didn't scrimp on the portion sizes. Very good service. The ambience was a bit stuffy and as a couple in our 40s, we were positively youthfull compared to our fellow diners. All in all, a good restaurant with some solid cooking.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: I just ate here on Saturday night and it was amazing. It is located just outside of the Washington Square Hotel and this is def a neighborhood gem! The wine list is nice and long and the food, from appetizers to dessert, was amazing! The only down fall was my very nice waitress brought out our appetizers and then disappeared. She did not mention she was leaving nor did the person who took over for her. Other than that, I would recommend it here.

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I classify it as **positive**. Here's my reasoning:

review.Review: Again, I have to tell you that I hate that others will come here and find out how great this place is, but I want them to do well. The food is really , really good and very fairly priced. Roz Corral who sings jazz at Sunday brunch , has a great voice and having this wonderful free show with great food is truly an outstanding NY experience!!

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

The rest of the review is extremely positive, with the reviewer using superlatives such as "really, really good", "great", and "outstanding". review.Review: North Square is a wonderful restaurant. Besides having very good food, it is one of the few restaurants that is quiet--great for conversation. It is also very attractive and comfortable. Great bread and an interesting, changing selection of wines by the glass. All in all a very enjoyable experience as always. Good to take out-of-towners to because of location across from Washington Square Park.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as "positive".

review.Review: We have eaten here many times, we chose North Square for our New Year's Eve dinner with two other couples because the food is always excellent, and, unlike other restaurants, they do not create a "special" holiday menu to gouge you. North Square offers wonderful and interesting choices, not only as dinner selections designed by the chef, but also as a la carte choices. They are completely accommodating when you ask to substitute one thing for another, a choice not always offered at other supposedly high class places. We've had both brunch and dinner here numerous times and are never apprehensive about introducing North Square to our friends, everyone always leaves extremely pleased. The atmosphere is cozy and friendly.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive'.

The reasons for this classification are:

* The reviewer states that the food is "always excellent", indicating a high level of satisfaction with the culinary experience.
* They appreciate that the restaurant does not create a "special" holiday menu to gouge customers, implying that the reviewer values transparency and fair pricing.
* The reviewer highlights the restaurant's accommodating nature, allowing for substitutions and offering interesting choices, which suggests that the staff is welcoming and attentive.

review.Review: North Square is one of my favorite restaurants. Unfortunately, they had a very bad night on this week. The mushroom soup had no culinary flair; it was as if they just put mushrooms in a blender and poured the result into a bowl. We ordered wine, appetizers (soup and salad), and raw oysters. The appetizers came first, and the oysters arrived while we had the appetizers. We still hadn't been served the wine. Dinners (duck and halibut) were so-so. Not at all on the level I had come to expect.

positive_comments.analysis: I would classify this review as 'negative'. review.Review: We love this place. In one of the trendiest neighborhoods in NY, this lovely restaurant is an oasis of consistency. It's our third time in the last year and each time was a great success. The food is superb and the attentive service makes it even better.

I would classify this review as 'positive'.

review.Review: Thanksgiving prix-fixe menu offered great variety at a surprisingly moderate price. The food was quite good; in some cases excellent. Sadly, the service was not. review.Review: Occasionally the food at North Square is a little tepid in its seasoning, but most of the time I come away impressed by how excellent the food is, especially during lunchtime. The crab and pear salad is one of my all-time favorite salads, and the tuna tartare is the best version I've had of this over-made dish. I've never had a bad meal there, and on top of everything else, they have an excellent (and changing) list of wines by the glass, and serve the best basket of bread around. One more bonus: for some reason, the restaurant draws an older, quieter crowd, which means that you can actually have an audible conversation there over lunch.

review.Review: Small but attractive restaurant in the heart of the west village with excellent food. You may have to wave down your waiter to get a saecond drink or glass of wine, but they are otherwise pretty attentive and you'll get that drink or wine rather quickly. All in all, very nice!

review.Review:
This was my second time dining at North Square. I came back because the first time was so good. This evening was equally as good! We had rack of lamb, roast duck, lobster risotto and a sausage plate. All perfectly prepared and beautifully presented. We sampled a cookie plate. Chewy flavorful gingerbread cookies were devine and I am not, a gingerbread fan. The wine list was had a good selection of new and old world wines.
The front room is small and cozy - beautiful flower arrangements on two sideboard tables - simple and sophisticated the rest of the room cozy. comfortable and elegant in a simple way. The back room has a bar and more tables - both are comfortable places in which to dine.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'positive'.

Overall, the review is glowing and suggests that North Square is a top-notch restaurant that offers excellent food and service.

review.Review: I've been to North Square several years ago and had an amazing brunch so when my special someone's birthday and our anniversary approached, I thought this neighborhood gem would be perfect for the occasion. review.Review: My girlfriend and I went during restaurant week and weren't overly impressed. We were seated at a small two-person table between two other duos. My girlfriend's chicken dish was much better than the snapper, and her banana cake was solid as well. All in all, though, I wouldn't recommend the food on the restaurant week menu, although this week's dishes look much better than what we had. Perhaps we just had a bad experience, but I'm not sure I would try it again soon.

review.Review: North Square turned out to be the perfect place for a blizzard dinner. Warm welcome, low key atmosphere, unobtrusive good service, and very good food. Starters were excellent -- lobster/crab cakes and mussels. For an entree, the char and rissoto blended together in a surprisingly nice way. The wine list is interesting, though it seemed a bit on the expensive side compared to the meal pricing. All in all, a very successful dinner.

review.Review:
The restaurant is in a great, vibrant neighborhood that we love, just off Washington Square Park. We appreciated the quiet setting for our group of four. The restaurant seems to attract a more "mature" customer. The hostess graciously let us switch to a table away from the door before the rest of our party came. Service was a little spotty, but the food was very good. Fillet mignon, shrimp bisque and chopped salad got rave reviews. Scallops, char and duck were good. The decor needs to be freshened up. The big floral bouquet in the room is a nice idea, but it look a bit tired when we were there; was it red carnations?
Next time I'll know to ask for a cozy spot in one of the banquettes along the wall.

If you can't get into Babbo or Blue Hill (and who can?), try North Square - they are around the corner from each other. You won't be disappointed.

review.Review: One of my favorite restaurants in the City. It's quietley elegant and cosy without being small or crowded and the noise level is low to moderate. The food is extremelly fresh and cooked to perfection and when you ask for it rare, it is! Seafood is wonderful with nice light sauces and very well cooked side order like broccoli or creamed spinach. I was able to stick to a low glycemic diet very easily. Prices are moderate and their wine list is fabulous. We had a dinner for 2 with an expensive bottle of wine and the bill was $130 including tip.

positive_comments.analysis:
I analyze the sentiment of this review as **positive** for the following reasons:

1. The reviewer uses superlatives such as "one of my favorite restaurants", "extremely fresh", "cooked to perfection", "wonderful", "fabulous", and "5/5 rating".

review.Review: I picked this place because I knew it would be quiet. It is the rare place in the village where you can hear a conversation. We were not rushed, and the food was fine. Noone raved about it, but all the plates were clean. I come here often because of the laid back atmosphere.

review.Review: We love the North Square Jazz brunch on Sunday. Food is great...entertainment wonderful and service very good. We try to go as often as possible.

review.Review: North Square is always a dependably great meal - lots of selection, fresh ingredients, and attentive service. We bring our own wine to enhance our meal, and feel that the corkage fee is fair. It continues to be our favorite restaurant for visiting friends and relatives.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as "positive".

* The reviewer mentions several positive aspects of the restaurant, including a "lot of selection", "fresh ingredients", and "attentive service".

review.Review: The menu is very innovative with lots of good choices. You are able to change the vegetables if you'd like something from a different entree. I find this very desirable since there are foods I am not able to eat. I had the duck breast with roasted beets which was absolutely delicious, and my friends who had the pork tenderloin were very pleased. The ambience is lovely with fresh flowers and the richly painted tile pictures go very well with the wall color. This was my first time at North Square and it was a very pleasurable dining experience.

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment analysis: Positive

Reason: The review highlights multiple positive aspects of the dining experience, including the innovative menu options, flexibility to customize vegetables, delicious food (specifically the duck breast and pork tenderloin), and lovely ambience. The reviewer also mentions that the overall experience was "very pleasurable", which further reinforces the positive sentiment. The reviewer's tone is enthusiastic and appreciative, indicating a positive opinion about their experience at North Square.

review.Review: We've been to North Square many times and although this time our server was less than responsive the restaurant -- its food, ambience and spirit-- were as always very good. It's in our neighborhood and it's a bargain. The food is always very good and we'll, of course, be back.

positive_comments.analysis:
Sentiment Analysis: Positive

Classification Reason: Although the reviewer mentions a negative experience with the server being "less than responsive", the reviewer highlights the restaurant's strengths, including "very good" food, "ambience", and "spirit". The reviewer also mentions that the restaurant is a "bargain" and that they will return. The fact that they have visited the restaurant many times before and will continue to do so suggests a positive overall experience. The 4-star rating also supports this classification.

review.Review:
The service was, overall, not satisfactory for this visit to North Square. Our waitress left mid-service, the hostess then doubling as server. We asked questions about a dessert, she repeated what was already on the menu. Then silence. Perhaps we should have asked her to consult with a more-knowledgeable server for more specifics?

And when we arrived on time, there were no tables available. Do they not check, nor honor Open Table online reservations?

The food was, as usual, quite wonderful. Perhaps this service was the exception to the usually reliable rule.

positive_comments.analysis:
I classify this review as 'negative' due to the majority of the content being critical of the service. The reviewer mentions several issues with the service, including:

* The waitress leaving mid-service and the hostess taking over, leading to a lack of knowledge on the menu
* Long silence with no response to questions about a dessert
* Disappointment with not having a table available despite having made an online reservation

The only positive comment in the review is a brief mention of the food being "quite wonderful", which is not enough to outweigh the negative comments about the service. Additionally, the reviewer mentions that the service was an "exception to the usually reliable rule", implying that they have had better experiences at the establishment in the past. The 4-star rating suggests that the reviewer still had a decent overall experience, but the negative comments about the service are the dominant sentiment in the review.

review.Review: I loved it so much the first time I went back the very next night with a friend and it lived up to the previous night's experience. I love the way they offer entrées and sides a la carte. That way I can get a steak and avoid the frites, substituting a cauliflower mash so I can keep the carbs way low. Pepper crusted filet mignon was perfectly cooked more flavorful than I've had in a long time. And the complimentary olives are out of this world, the best I've ever had. And I just had to indulge in the nicely varied bread basket, dipping tidbits in the very taste olive oil provided.

review.Review: North Square is a hidden gem. Inventive, modern and beautifully cooked food(several of us wanted to lick our plates at some point in the meal. We felt spoilt for choice by the menu and every plate was delicious. Teensy bit stuffy - we were shushed by a neighbouring table for laughing at one point, and were the youngest diners by 20 years. Overly laid back service - wine wasn't left on the table, waiters preferring to serve throughout, but then we had to keep waiving for attention. Waiter also didn't feel the need to write down our order (it was the only intellectual stimulation he got in his day, he told us) but the wrong salad appeared initially for one of our party, so perhaps he brain wasn't quite up to the workout...

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as 'positive' overall, with a few constructive criticisms.

The reviewer uses phrases such as "hidden gem", "beautifully cooked food", and "every plate was delicious", which convey a strong positive sentiment. They also mention that they felt "spoilt for choice" by the menu, which suggests that they were excited and satisfied with the options.

However, the reviewer does mention a few negative aspects, such as the restaurant being "teensy bit stuffy", feeling like they were being shushed for laughing, and the service being "overly laid back" to the point of having to constantly wave for attention. Additionally, there is a mention of a mistake with one of the salads.

Despite these criticisms, the reviewer's overall tone is still positive, as they acknowledge them in a lighthearted and humorous way. They also give the restaurant a 4-star rating, which suggests that they were generally pleased with their experience.

review.Review: We went to North Square for Valentine's day, which had a prix fixe menu. The food was delicious, but I was rather disappointed with the service. While somewhat attentive at first, our server disappeared after our entrees were brought out, and once we were finished our plates sat empty on our table for nearly 20 minutes. I do prefer a wait staff that is not always hovering, but I also want to be able to flag down a server if i need something. However, the food was very very good, really enjoyed every course.

positive_comments.analysis:
After analyzing the review, I classify the sentiment as 'mixed' rather than purely positive or negative. Here's my reasoning:

* The reviewer mentions that the food was "delicious" and "very very good", which suggests that they enjoyed the culinary experience.
* However, they express disappointment with the service, citing that the server disappeared after delivering their entrees and left their plates empty for nearly 20 minutes. This imparts a negative tone to the review.
* The reviewer also mentions a specific issue with the service, which is the lack of availability to flag down a server when needed, implying that the service was not up to par.
* Despite these issues, the reviewer still concludes by saying that they "really enjoyed every course", which suggests that the positive aspects of the meal outweighed the negative aspects of the service.

Given the mixed reviews, I would rate the sentiment as neutral/average. The customer is neither extremely pleased nor severely dissatisfied. The rating of 3 out of 5 stars also supports this classification.

review.Review: This casual restaurant is ALWAYS warm and welcoming, and seems to be a neighborhood favorite. review.Review: North Square is a reliable and very reasonably priced standby.  The atmosphere is pleasant and the food is good.  The service is only okay. They need to work on that.

review.Review: The crab cakes and the tuna tartare appetizers were very good and were at a fair price.The bread and olives served before the meal were excellent. The yellowfin tuna entree and the ravioli were great. The service was good as well. My only concerns were with the decor and temperature of the restuarnt. The decor looked like a typical old Italian restaurant in NJ that needed a major update (only thing missing was the plastic plants). There were at least 3 different kinds of wallpaper and very eighties style pictures. Despite the outside temperature being about 50 degrees the restaurant pumped out the AC at max and several guests were wearing their winter jackets at the dinner tables-this should never happen!I would not return despite the food.

positive_comments.analysis:
I would classify this review as "mixed", rather than strictly "positive" or "negative". Here's why:

* The bread and olives served before the meal were excellent
* The service was good

The reviewer's overall rating of 3 stars suggests that while they appreciated the food and service, their negative experiences with the decor and temperature outweighed the positives.
